verses.english: These are the garments which are to be made: the breastplate, the ephod, the priestly robe, the finely woven tunic, the turban, and the sash. They shall make these sacred garments for Aaron your brother and for his sons, so that they may perform the sacred office of priest for me.

verses.latin: Aurum, et hyacinthum, et purpuram, coccumque bis tinctum, et byssum retorsam, afferent.
verses.english: They shall bring gold, blue thread, purple thread, scarlet yarn that is dyed twice, and twisted fine linen.

verses.latin: Ephod autem facies de auro, et hyacintho, et purpura, et cocco bis tincto, et bysso retorta, opere polymitario.
verses.english: You shall make the ephod from gold, blue thread, purple thread, scarlet yarn dyed twice, and twisted fine linen, crafted with skillful weaving.

verses.latin: Duas oras in singulis partibus ejus ex utraque parte sibi junges.
verses.english: You shall attach two shoulder pieces to its two sides, joining them together.

verses.latin: Ipsam quoque texturam ephod, et vestimentum unum, opere vario, ejusdem operis erit, ex auro, et hyacintho, et purpura, et cocco bis tincto, et bysso retorta.
verses.english: The woven band of the ephod itself, which is a single piece, shall be made of the same skillful craftsmanship and materials: gold, blue thread, purple thread, scarlet yarn dyed twice, and twisted fine linen.

verses.latin: Sumesque duos lapides onychinos, et sculpes in eis nomina filiorum Israel:
verses.english: You shall take two onyx stones and engrave upon them the names of the children of Israel:

verses.latin: sex nomina in lapide uno, et sex reliqua in altero, juxta ordinem nativitatis eorum.
verses.english: Six names on one stone, and the remaining six names on the other stone, according to the order of their birth.

verses.latin: Opere sculptoris, et arte gemmarii, sculpes ambos lapides nominibus filiorum Israel, inclusos auro, atque conexos.
verses.english: With the skill of an engraver, like those who carve precious stones, you shall engrave both stones with the names of the children of Israel, setting them in gold filigree and joining them securely.

verses.latin: Et pones eos in humeris ephod, monumenta filiorum Israel. Portabitque Aaron nomina eorum coram Domino super utrumque humerum ad recordationem.
verses.english: You shall place these stones on the shoulder pieces of the ephod, to serve as a memorial for the children of Israel. Aaron shall carry their names before the Lord upon both his shoulders, as a constant remembrance.

verses.latin: Facies et articulos de auro, duos,
verses.english: You shall also make two settings of gold,

verses.latin: et duas catenulas ex auro purissimo sibi invicem cohaerentes, quas religabis articulis.
verses.english: and two chains of pure gold, woven like cords and intertwined with each other, which you shall fasten to the gold settings.

verses.latin: Rationale quoque judicii facies opere polymitario, juxta texturam ephod, de auro, et hyacintho, et purpura, et cocco bis tincto, et bysso retorta.
verses.english: You shall also make the breastplate of judgment, crafted with the same skillful weaving as the ephod, from gold, blue thread, purple thread, scarlet yarn dyed twice, and twisted fine linen.

verses.latin: Quadrangulum erit, duplex, mensurae palmi.
verses.english: It shall be square and doubled over, measuring a span in length and a span in width.

verses.latin: Ponesque in eo quatuor ordines lapidum. In primo ordine erit sardius, et topazius, et smaragdus.
verses.english: You shall place in it four rows of precious stones. In the first row, there shall be a sardius, a topaz, and an emerald.

verses.latin: In secundo, carbunculus, et sapphirus, et jaspis.
verses.english: In the second row, a carbuncle, a sapphire, and a jasper.

verses.latin: In tertio, ligurius, et achates, et amethystus.
verses.english: In the third row, a ligurius, an agate, and an amethyst.

verses.latin: In quarto, chrysolithus, et onyx, et beryllus, distincti auro, et opere juncti.
verses.english: In the fourth row, a chrysolite, an onyx, and a beryl. These stones shall be set in gold filigree and securely joined.

verses.latin: Eruntque duodecim lapides nominibus filiorum Israel exsculpti, singuli per nomina singulorum, duodecim tribuum.
verses.english: There shall be twelve stones, each engraved with the name of one of the children of Israel, corresponding to each of the twelve tribes.

verses.latin: Facies in rationale catenulas quas et in ephod, de auro purissimo sibi invicem cohaerentes opere funiculi:
verses.english: For the breastplate, you shall make chains of pure gold, crafted like cords and intertwined with each other, just as you did for the ephod.

verses.latin: quos inseres duobus annulis, qui erunt in utraque parte rationalis.
verses.english: You shall put these chains through two rings, which are to be on each side of the breastplate.

verses.latin: Duas quoque alias catenulas aureas mitteris duobus annulis, qui in summitate erunt ephod ex parte anteriori.
verses.english: You shall also put two other gold chains into two rings that are to be at the top of the ephod, on its front side.

verses.latin: Ipsasque junges articulis, qui sunt in humeris ephod, in faciem.
verses.english: Then you shall join these chains to the gold settings that are on the front of the ephod's shoulder pieces.

verses.latin: Facies et duos annulos aureos, quos pones in extremitatibus rationalis, in oris, quae respiciunt ephod intrinsecus.
verses.english: You shall also make two gold rings, which you shall place at the two lower ends of the breastplate, on the inner edge that faces the ephod.

verses.latin: Necnon et alios duos annulos aureos, quos pones in utraque parte ephod deorsum, contra juncturam inferioris loci, ex adverso, et super balteum ephod.
verses.english: And two other gold rings you shall place on each side of the ephod, below, at its lower joint, on the front, and above the woven band of the ephod.

verses.latin: Et junges rationale annulis ejus ad annulos ephod funiculo hyacinthino, ut maneat junctura et a se invicem non possit laxari.
verses.english: You shall join the breastplate by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a blue cord, so that the breastplate remains securely attached and cannot become loose from the ephod.

verses.latin: Omniaque nomina filiorum Israel portabit Aaron in rationale judicii super pectus suum, ingressus sanctuarium, monumentum coram Domino in sempiternum.
verses.english: And Aaron shall carry all the names of the children of Israel in the breastplate of judgment upon his chest whenever he enters the sanctuary. This will be a perpetual memorial before the Lord.

verses.latin: Ponesque in rationale judicii Urim et Thummim, quae erunt in pectore Aaron, quando ingredietur coram Domino: et portabit judicium filiorum Israel in pectore suo coram Domino semper.
verses.english: You shall put the Urim and the Thummim into the breastplate of judgment. These sacred objects are to be on Aaron's chest when he enters before the Lord. Thus, Aaron shall always carry the means of discerning God's judgment for the children of Israel upon his chest before the Lord.

verses.latin: Et facies tunicam ephod totam hyacinthinam,
verses.english: You shall make the robe of the ephod entirely of blue thread.

verses.latin: et erit capitium in medio ejus, et ora per circuitum textilis, sicut fieri solet in extremis vestium, ne facile rumpatur.
verses.english: There shall be an opening for the head in its middle, with a woven border around this opening, like the collar of a woven garment, so that it will not easily tear.

verses.latin: Deorsum vero ad pedes ejus, quasi mala punica ex hyacintho, et purpura, et cocco bis tincto, per circuitum, et inter haec tintinnabula aurea,
verses.english: At the bottom hem of the robe, you shall make pomegranates of blue thread, purple thread, and scarlet yarn dyed twice, all around the hem. And in between these pomegranates, you shall place gold bells.

verses.latin: ut sit tintinnabulum aureum, et malum punicum, tintinnabulum aureum, et malum punicum, per circuitum tunicae.
verses.english: The pattern shall be a gold bell, then a pomegranate, then a gold bell, then a pomegranate, and so on, all around the hem of the robe.

verses.latin: Et vestietur Aaron ea in ministerio, ut audiatur sonitus quando ingreditur et egreditur sanctuarium in conspectu Domini, et ne moriatur.
verses.english: Aaron shall wear this robe when he ministers as a priest, so that the sound of the bells is heard when he enters and exits the sanctuary before the Lord. This is to ensure his safety and prevent his death while ministering in God's presence.

verses.latin: Facies et laminam de auro purissimo, in qua sculpes opere cælantis, Sanctum Domini.
verses.english: You shall also make a plate of pure gold, and engrave upon it, as one engraves a seal, the words: 'Holy to the Lord'.

verses.latin: Ligabisque eam vitta hyacinthina, et erit super cidarim,
verses.english: You shall fasten this plate with a blue cord, and it shall be worn upon the turban,

verses.latin: in fronte Aaron: et portabit Aaron iniquitates eorum quae oblata sunt, et sanctificata a filiis Israel, in omnibus muneribus et donariis eorum. Eritque lamina semper in fronte ejus, ut placati sint Dominus super illos.
verses.english: on Aaron’s forehead. Aaron shall bear the iniquities connected with the holy offerings, those consecrated by the children of Israel, in all their sacred gifts and oblations. This gold plate shall always be on his forehead, so that the Lord may be gracious to the Israelites, accepting their offerings and forgiving any unintended sin in their sacred acts.

verses.latin: Cidarim quoque de bysso, et stricta linea, intextam variabis opere plumario.
verses.english: You shall also make the turban of fine linen, and you shall weave the finely checkered tunic with embroidered needlework.

verses.latin: Porro filiis Aaron tunicas lineas facies, et balteos, et mitras, in gloriam et decorem.
verses.english: Furthermore, for Aaron's sons, you shall make linen tunics, sashes, and caps, for their glory and for their beauty.

verses.latin: Hoc est ergo quod facies ut ministrent mihi in sacerdotium. Tolle vitulum de armento et duos arietes immaculatos
verses.english: Now, this is the ritual you shall perform to consecrate Aaron and his sons, so they may serve Me as priests. From the herd, take one young bull; also take two rams that are physically perfect and without blemish.

verses.latin: Panes azymos et tortas absque fermento conspersas oleo, lagana quoque azyma uncta oleo, de simila triticea facies.
verses.english: From the finest wheat flour, you shall bake unleavened bread, as well as cakes made without yeast but mixed with oil. Also, make unleavened wafers that are brushed with oil.

verses.latin: Et mittes in canistro, offeresque. Vitulum autem et duos arietes.
verses.english: Place all these baked goods into one basket, and then present that basket to God. You shall also present the young bull and the two rams for the sacred offerings.

verses.latin: Et adducas Aaron et filios ejus ad ostium tabernaculi testimonii. Lavabisque eos aqua.
verses.english: Bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance of the Tabernacle of Testimony, the sacred dwelling where God’s presence is made known. There, you shall ritually cleanse them by washing them with water.

verses.latin: Et indues Aaron vestimentis ejus, id est, tunica et superhumerali et rationali, quam ligabis balteo.
verses.english: Then, you shall dress Aaron in his consecrated priestly garments. These include the long tunic, the ephod (a special outer garment), and the breastpiece. You must secure the ephod and breastpiece with its woven sash.

verses.latin: Et pones mitram in capite ejus, et lamminam sanctam super mitram.
verses.english: Next, place the priestly turban upon Aaron’s head, and fasten the sacred golden plate, inscribed with 'Holy to the Lord,' onto the front of the turban.

verses.latin: Et oleum unctionis fundes super caput ejus: atque hoc ritu consecrabitur.
verses.english: Afterward, pour the special anointing oil generously upon Aaron’s head. Through this sacred anointing ritual, Aaron will be fully consecrated and set apart for God’s service.

verses.latin: Filios quoque ejus applicabis, induesque tunicis,
verses.english: Bring Aaron’s sons forward also, and dress them in their tunics, the long white priestly garments.

verses.latin: cingesque balteo, Aaron et filios ejus: et impones eis mitras, eruntque sacerdotes mei lege perpetua. Postquam initiasti manus eorum,
verses.english: You shall tie sashes around both Aaron and his sons. Then, place turbans on the heads of Aaron’s sons. By this ceremony, they will become My priests according to an eternal, unchangeable law. After you have fully ordained them through this hand-consecrating ceremony,

verses.latin: adduces vitulum coram tabernaculo testimonii. Imponentque Aaron et filii ejus manus suas super caput illius.
verses.english: You shall bring the young bull, designated for the purification offering, to the front of the Tabernacle of Testimony. There, Aaron and his sons will lay their hands firmly upon the bull’s head, signifying the transfer of sin.

verses.latin: Mactabisque eum in conspectu Domini, juxta ostium tabernaculi testimonii.
verses.english: You shall then slaughter the bull in the presence of the Lord, right at the entrance of the Tabernacle of Testimony.

verses.latin: Et sumptum de sanguine vituli, pones super cornua altaris digito tuo: totumque reliquum sanguinem fundes juxta basim ejus.
verses.english: Take some of the bull’s blood and, with your finger, smear it onto the four horns of the altar of burnt offering. Then, pour all the remaining blood from the bull at the base of the altar.

verses.latin: Assumesque omnem adipem, qui operit vitalia, et reticulum de jecore, et duos renunculos, et saepum, qui super eos est: et offeres incensum super altare.
verses.english: Take all the fat that covers the bull’s internal organs, including the fatty lobe that is on the liver, and both kidneys with their surrounding fat. You are to burn these parts on the altar as a smoke offering.

verses.latin: Carnes vero vituli et pellem et fimum combures extra castra, quia pro peccato est.
verses.english: However, the bull’s flesh, its hide, and its dung you must carry outside the camp and burn completely with fire, because this animal serves as a purification offering to atone for sins.

verses.latin: Unum quoque arietem sumes: et ponent Aaron et filii ejus manus suas super caput ejus.
verses.english: Next, you shall take one of the rams, designated for the burnt offering. Aaron and his sons will lay their hands upon its head, signifying dedication to God.

verses.latin: Quem cum mactaveris, tolles sanguinem ejus, et fundes super altare per circuitum.
verses.english: Once you have slaughtered this ram, take its blood and pour it all around the altar of burnt offering.

verses.latin: Ipsumque arietem secabis in frusta: lavabisque intestina ejus et pedes, et pones super incensum carnibus, et capiti, atque omnibus simul concisis.
verses.english: Cut the ram’s body into its separate pieces. Then, wash its internal organs and its legs thoroughly with water. Afterward, arrange these washed parts, along with the head and all the other cut pieces, on the altar to be burned.

verses.latin: Offeresque totum arietem in incensum Domino, quia est holocaustum Domini, odor suavitatis, oblatio Domini.
verses.english: You shall offer the entire ram as a burnt offering, completely consumed by fire to the Lord. This is a burnt offering for the Lord, a pleasing aroma that signifies God’s acceptance, an offering given entirely to the Lord.

verses.latin: Arietem quoque alterum sumes: super cujus caput ponent Aaron et filii ejus manus suas.
verses.english: Now, take the second ram, the ram designated for the ordination ceremony. Aaron and his sons will lay their hands upon its head.

verses.latin: Quem cum mactaveris, tolles de sanguine ejus, et pones super extremum auriculae dextrae Aaron, et filiorum ejus, et super pollices manuum ac pedum eorum dexterarum: fundesque sanguinem super altare per circuitum.
verses.english: When you have slaughtered this ram, take some of its blood. With your finger, put a small amount of blood on the lobe of Aaron’s right ear, and on the lobes of his sons’ right ears. Also, put blood on the thumb of their right hands and on the great toe of their right feet. The rest of the blood you shall pour all around the altar of burnt offering.

verses.latin: Et assumens de sanguine, qui est super altare, et de oleo unctionis, asperges Aaron, et vestimentis ejus, et filiis ejus, et vestibus eorum. Et sanctificabuntur ipsi et vestes eorum.
verses.english: Then, take some of the blood that is on the altar and mix it with some of the anointing oil. Sprinkle this mixture upon Aaron and his priestly garments, and upon his sons and their priestly garments. In this way, Aaron and his sons, along with their garments, shall all be fully consecrated and made holy.

verses.latin: Sumes quoque de ariete armum, et caudam, et adipem qui operit vitalia, et reticulum jecoris, et duos renunculos, et adipem qui super eos est, et armum dextrum, quia est aries consecrationis.
verses.english: From the ram of ordination, you shall take the fat tail, the fat that covers the internal organs, the fatty lobe of the liver, both kidneys with their surrounding fat, and the right thigh. These are specific parts for the ram used in this priestly consecration ceremony.

verses.latin: Et panem unum conspersum oleo, et laganum unum ex azymis, et tortam unam de canistro azymorum, quod est in conspectu Domini.
verses.english: Also, from the basket of unleavened bread that is placed before the Lord, take one loaf of bread made with oil, one unleavened cake, and one unleavened wafer.

verses.latin: Ponesque universa super manus Aaron et filiorum ejus, et elevabis consecrata, tenens manibus eorum coram Domino.
verses.english: Place all these items—the meat portions and the breads—upon the hands of Aaron and his sons. Then, you shall perform the wave offering, holding their hands as you present these consecrated things before the Lord.

verses.latin: Suscipiesque cuncta de manibus eorum, et combures super altare holocausti, in odorem suavitatis coram Domino, quia est oblatio Domini.
verses.english: After the wave offering, take all the items from their hands and burn them completely on the altar of burnt offering. This will be a pleasing aroma before the Lord, for it is a special offering given to the Lord.

verses.latin: Sumes quoque pectusculum de ariete consecrationis, quod est Aaron, et elevabis illud in elationem coram Domino: eritque pars tua.
verses.english: You shall take the breast from the ram of ordination, which is designated for Aaron, and present it as a wave offering before the Lord. This breast will then become your designated portion, Moses.

verses.latin: Sanctificabisque pectusculum elationis, et armum separationis, quae separata sunt de ariete, tam Aaron quam filiorum ejus:
verses.english: You shall consecrate the breast that was waved as a wave offering, and the thigh that was presented as a heave offering. These portions have been set apart from the ram for both Aaron and his sons.

verses.latin: et erunt Aaron et filiis ejus jure perpetuo a filiis Israel: quia elatio est et separatio de pacificis victimis eorum, quae offerunt Domino.
verses.english: These portions shall be a perpetual entitlement for Aaron and his sons from the people of Israel. For they are a wave offering and a heave offering, taken from the peace offerings that the Israelites present to the Lord, designating them as holy sustenance for the priests.

verses.latin: Vestimentum autem sanctum, quo utitur Aaron, habebunt filii ejus post eum, ut unguantur in eo, et consecrentur manus eorum.
verses.english: The holy garments that Aaron wears as high priest shall be passed down to his sons who succeed him. They are to be anointed in these very garments, and their hands consecrated, as part of their own ordination.

verses.latin: Septem diebus utetur illis, qui sacerdos pro eo fuerit constitutus, et qui intrabit post illum in tabernaculum testimonii, ut ministret in sanctuario.
verses.english: The son who is appointed priest in Aaron’s place, and who enters the Tabernacle of Testimony to minister in the Holy Place, must wear these garments for seven consecutive days.

verses.latin: Arietem quoque consecrationis tolles, et coques carnes ejus in loco sancto.
verses.english: You shall also take the ram that was used for the ordination ceremony and cook its meat in a sacred area within the Tabernacle courtyard.

verses.latin: Et comedent Aaron et filii ejus carnes arietis, et panes, qui sunt in canistro, juxta ostium tabernaculi testimonii.
verses.english: Aaron and his sons are to eat the meat of that ram, along with the bread from the basket, at the entrance of the Tabernacle of Testimony. This shared meal is an integral part of their consecration.

verses.latin: Ut immolatis per quae initiarentur, et sanctificarentur. Alienigena non comedet ex eis, quia sancta sunt.
verses.english: They shall eat these things because they were offered to make atonement for their ordination and to consecrate them. No unauthorized person, no one outside the priestly family, may eat of these consecrated items, because they are holy and set apart for God.

verses.latin: Quod si remanserit de carnibus consecratis, sive de panibus usque mane, combures reliquias igni: nec comedentur, eo quod sanctificata sunt.
verses.english: If any of the consecrated meat or any of the bread remains until the morning, you must burn the leftovers completely with fire. They are not to be eaten, because they have been made holy and cannot be kept overnight.

verses.latin: Omnia, quae præcepi tibi, facies super Aaron et filios ejus. Septem diebus consecrabis manus eorum:
verses.english: You shall carry out all these commands precisely as I have instructed regarding Aaron and his sons. For seven full days, you shall perform the full ordination ceremony, consecrating their hands for service.

verses.latin: et vitulum pro peccato offeres, per singulos dies ad expiandum. Mundabisque altare, cum immolaveris hostiam in expiationem: et unges illud in sanctificationem.
verses.english: Moreover, each day of these seven days, you shall offer a young bull as a sin offering to make atonement for the priests. When you offer this sacrificial atonement, you shall also purify the altar and anoint it with oil to consecrate it, making it holy for God.

verses.latin: Septem diebus expiabis altare et sanctificabis illud: et erit sanctum sanctorum. Omnis qui tetigerit illud, sanctificabitur.
verses.english: For seven days, you shall perform atonement for the altar and consecrate it. After this, the altar will be most holy, a true holy of holies. Everything and everyone who touches that consecrated altar shall become holy, absorbing its sacred status.

verses.latin: Hoc est quod facies super altare: agnos anniculos duos per singulos dies jugiter.
verses.english: Now, this is what you shall offer on the altar regularly and continually: two lambs, each one year old, every single day.

verses.latin: Unum agnum mane, et alterum vespere.
verses.english: One lamb is to be offered in the morning, and the other lamb in the evening, establishing a daily rhythm of worship.

verses.latin: Decimam partem similae conspersae oleo contuso, quarta parte hin: et libamentum ejus, quarta pars hin vini ad singulos agnos.
verses.english: With the first lamb, you shall offer a tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with a quarter of a hin of pressed oil. And with each lamb, there shall be a drink offering of a quarter of a hin of wine, poured out before the Lord.

verses.latin: Facies et altare ad succensendum incensum de lignis setim fabricabis.
verses.english: You shall construct an altar for the burning of incense; you must make this altar from durable acacia wood.

verses.latin: Cujus longitudo erit cubiti, et latitudo cubiti, id est quadrangulum, et duobus cubitis altitudo. Cornua ex ipso procedent.
verses.english: Its length will be one cubit, and its width one cubit, meaning it will be square. Its height will be two cubits. Its horns, a part of its construction, will extend upwards from it.

verses.latin: Vestiesque illud auro purissimo, tam cancellos ejus quam parietes, et cornua. Faciesque ei coronam auream per circuitum.
verses.english: You shall cover it with the purest gold, both its top and its sides, and its horns. And you shall make a golden rim around its top.

verses.latin: Et duos annulos aureos pones sub corona per singula latera, ut mittantur in eos vectes, et possit altare portari.
verses.english: And you shall place two golden rings below the rim on its opposite sides, so that poles may be inserted into them, and the altar can be carried by these poles.

verses.latin: Ipsos quoque vectes facies de lignis setim, et inaurabis auro.
verses.english: You shall also make these poles from acacia wood and cover them with gold.

verses.latin: Ponesque altare contra velum, quod appenditur ante arcam testimonii, ante propitiatorium, quo tegitur testimonium, ubi colloquar tibi.
verses.english: You shall place this altar in front of the veil that hangs before the Ark of the Testimony. It will be positioned before the atonement cover that shields the Testimony, which is the very place where I will speak with you.

verses.latin: Et adolebit super eo Aaron incensum odoris suavissimi singulis matutinis, cum componet lucernas, accendet illud:
verses.english: And Aaron shall burn upon this altar a most fragrant incense every morning. When he prepares the lamps, he shall light the incense upon it.

verses.latin: et cum vesperi collocabit, uret thymiama sempiternum coram Domino in generationes vestras.
verses.english: And when he sets up the lamps in the evening, he shall burn incense again, a perpetual offering before the Lord throughout all your generations.

verses.latin: Non offeretis super eo incensum compositum, nec holocaustum, nec sacrificium. Nec libamenta libabitis.
verses.english: You shall not offer upon it any other compounded incense, nor any burnt offering, nor any grain offering. Nor shall you pour out any drink offerings upon it.

verses.latin: Expurgabitque Aaron super cornua ejus semel in anno de sanguine pro peccato, et pacabit illud et sanctificabit in generationibus vestris. Sanctum sanctorum erit Domino.
verses.english: And Aaron shall make atonement upon its horns once each year with the blood from the sin offering. He shall purify it and consecrate it throughout your generations; it shall be most holy to the Lord.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying this:

verses.latin: Cum feceris summam filiorum Israël juxta numerum eorum, dabunt singuli pretium pro animabus suis Domino, et non erit plaga in eis, cum recensentur.
verses.english: When you take a census of the sons of Israel according to their numbers, each one shall give a ransom for his soul to the Lord, so that no plague may come upon them when they are counted.

verses.latin: Hoc autem dabit omnis qui transit ad nomen: medium siclum juxta pondus sanctuarii (siclus viginti obolos habet), media pars sicli offeretur Domino.
verses.english: This is what everyone who is counted shall give: half a shekel, according to the standard of the sanctuary shekel (which is twenty gerahs). This half-shekel portion shall be offered to the Lord.

verses.latin: Omnis qui transit ad numerum, a viginti annis et supra, dabit pretium.
verses.english: Everyone who is counted, from twenty years old and above, shall give this ransom.

verses.latin: Dives non superaddet, et pauper non minuet medium siclum, cum dabunt pretium animarum suarum Domino.
verses.english: The rich shall not give more, nor shall the poor give less than the half-shekel, when they give the ransom for their souls to the Lord.

verses.latin: Accipiesque pecuniam a filiis Israël pro expiatione, et dabis in usus tabernaculi testimonii, ut sit oblatio filiorum Israël in monumentum coram Domino ad orandum pro animabus eorum.
verses.english: You shall receive this money of atonement from the sons of Israel and dedicate it for the service of the Tabernacle of the Testimony. It shall be a memorial offering from the sons of Israel before the Lord, to make atonement for their souls.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying this:

verses.latin: Facies et labrum aeneum cum basi sua ad lavandum, ponesque illud inter tabernaculum testimonii et altare. Et mittes in eo aquam.
verses.english: You shall also construct a bronze basin with its bronze stand for washing. You shall place it between the Tabernacle of the Testimony and the altar. And you shall put water in it.

verses.latin: Lavantque in eo Aaron et filii ejus manus suas ac pedes,
verses.english: Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and their feet in it.

verses.latin: quando ingressuri sunt tabernaculum testimonii, et quando appropinquaturi altari ut offerant incensum Domino, ne pereant.
verses.english: When they are about to enter the Tabernacle of the Testimony, and when they are about to approach the altar to offer incense to the Lord, they must wash so that they do not die.

verses.latin: Cumque lavabunt manus et pedes, non intrabunt tabernaculum testimonii, nec altari appropinquabunt, ut suffitum Domino offerant, ne moriantur. Erit sempiternum hoc religiosum Aaron et semini ejus in successionibus eorum.
verses.english: When they wash their hands and feet, they shall not enter the Tabernacle of the Testimony, nor shall they approach the altar to offer a fragrant offering to the Lord, lest they die. This ritual washing shall be a perpetual religious law for Aaron and his descendants throughout their generations.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens:
verses.english: Then the Lord spoke to Moses, saying this:

verses.latin: Accipe aromata prima, myrrhæ optimæ quingentos siclos, et cinnamomi mediati, ducentos quinquaginta, calamique scripti ducentos quinquaginta,
verses.english: Take the finest spices: five hundred shekels of liquid myrrh, two hundred and fifty shekels of fragrant cinnamon, and two hundred and fifty shekels of fragrant calamus.

verses.latin: cassæ autem quingentos siclos, et olei de oliva mensuram hinc.
verses.english: Also, take five hundred shekels of cassia, and one hin of olive oil.

verses.latin: Faciesque unctionis oleum sanctum, unguentum compositum opere pigmentarii, et erit unctionis oleum sanctum.
verses.english: And from these ingredients, you shall make holy anointing oil, a fragrant ointment skillfully compounded by a perfumer; it shall be a holy anointing oil.

verses.latin: Ungues ex eo tabernaculum testimonii, et arcam testimonii,
verses.english: With this oil, you shall anoint the Tabernacle of the Testimony and the Ark of the Testimony.

verses.latin: mensam cum vasis suis, et candelabrum, et omnem apparatum ejus,
verses.english: You shall also anoint the table with all its vessels, and the lampstand with all its accessories.

verses.latin: altaria thymiamatis, et holocausti, et universa vasa, quæ in usum eorum pertinent.
verses.english: You shall anoint both the altar of incense and the altar of burnt offerings, along with all the vessels that pertain to their service.

verses.latin: Sanctificabisque omnia, et erunt Sancta sanctorum. Omnis qui tetigerit ea, sanctificabitur.
verses.english: You shall consecrate all these items, and they will become most holy. Everyone who touches them will be made holy by contact.

verses.latin: Aaron quoque et filios ejus unges, et sanctificabis, ut sacerdotio fungantur mihi.
verses.english: You shall also anoint Aaron and his sons, and you shall consecrate them so that they may serve Me as priests.

verses.latin: Filis quoque Israël loqueris, dicens: Oleum unctionis sanctum erit mihi in generationes vestras.
verses.english: You shall also speak to the sons of Israel, saying: This holy anointing oil shall be set apart for Me throughout your generations.

verses.latin: Caro hominis non ungetur ex eo, et juxta compositionem ejus non facietis aliud: quia sanctificatum est, et sanctum erit vobis.
verses.english: The body of a common person shall not be anointed with it, and you shall not make any other oil with a similar composition. Because it has been consecrated, it shall remain holy to you.

verses.latin: Quicumque tale quid fecerit, et dederit ex eo alieno, extermiabitur de populis suis.
verses.english: Whoever makes anything like it, or puts any of it on a foreigner, shall be cut off from his people.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen: Sume tibi aromata, stacten, et onycham, galbanum boni odoris, et thuris lucidi simil pondere omnia.
verses.english: The Lord also said to Moses: Take for yourself fragrant spices—liquid storax, onycha, sweet-smelling galbanum, and pure frankincense. All these spices must be of equal weight.

verses.latin: Faciesque incensum compositum opere pigmentarii, mistum diligenter, et purum, ac sanctificatione dignum.
verses.english: And from these, you shall make compounded incense, the work of a perfumer, carefully blended, pure, and worthy of consecration.

verses.latin: Cumque comminueris illud minutissime, pones ex eo coram tabernaculo testimonii, ubi loquar tibi. Sanctum sanctorum erit vobis.
verses.english: When you have ground it very finely, you shall place some of it before the Tabernacle of the Testimony, where I will speak with you. This incense shall be most holy to you.

verses.latin: Incensum, quod in hac compositione factum fuerit, non facietis vobis, sed Domino consecratum tenebitis.
verses.english: The incense that is made with this precise composition, you shall not make for yourselves, but you shall keep it consecrated exclusively for the Lord.

verses.latin: Quicumque fecerit tale aliquid ut odore illius perfruatur, extermiabitur de populis suis.
verses.english: Whoever makes anything like it simply to enjoy its fragrance shall be cut off from his people.

verses.latin: N/A
verses.english: N/A

verses.latin: N/A
verses.english: N/A

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens :
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying:

verses.latin: Ecce nominavi Beseleel filium Uri filii Hur de tribu Juda :
verses.english: Look, I have specifically called Bezaleel, the son of Uri, the son of Hur, from the tribe of Judah, by name.

verses.latin: et implevi eum spiritu Dei, sapientia, et intelligentia, et scientia in omni opere,
verses.english: and I have filled him with the Spirit of God, endowing him with wisdom, and understanding, and knowledge for every kind of work,

verses.latin: ad excogitandum quicquid fabre fieri potest, et ad opus juncturæ, et ad operandum in auro, et argento, et ære,
verses.english: to devise all sorts of intricate designs that can be crafted, and for the work of joining pieces together, and to work with gold, and silver, and bronze.

verses.latin: et in cælaturâ marmorum, et diversorum lapidum, et opere carpentario, et quicquid artium excogitari potest.
verses.english: and in the carving of marble, and various other stones, and in carpentry work, and for devising any type of artistic skill imaginable.

verses.latin: Ego dedi ei socium Ooliab filium Achisamech de tribu Dan :
verses.english: I Myself have given him a companion, Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, from the tribe of Dan.

verses.latin: et in corde omnis periti posui sapientiam, ut faciant omnia quæ præcepi tibi,
verses.english: and in the heart of every skilled artisan, I have placed wisdom, so that they may accomplish everything I have commanded you:

verses.latin: tabernaculum fœderis, et arcam testimonii, et propitiatorium quod super illam est, et cuncta vasa tabernaculi,
verses.english: the Tabernacle of the Covenant, and the Ark of the Testimony, and the Mercy Seat which is upon it, and all the furnishings of the Tabernacle,

verses.latin: et mensam cum vasis suis, et candelabrum purissimum cum vasis suis, et altare incensi,
verses.english: and the table with its utensils, and the lampstand of pure gold with its utensils, and the altar of incense,

verses.latin: et altare holocausti cum vasis suis, omniaque utensilia tabernaculi,
verses.english: and the altar of burnt offerings with its utensils, and all the other implements of the Tabernacle,

verses.latin: vestes quoque sanctas Beseleel sacerdotalibus officiis, et vestes pro ministris,
verses.english: and also the sacred priestly vestments for Bezaleel for his priestly duties, and the garments for the other ministers,

verses.latin: et oleum unctionis, et thymiama aromatum ad sancta :
verses.english: and the anointing oil, and the sweet-smelling incense for the holy place.

verses.latin: omnia quæcumque præcepi tibi, facient.
verses.english: They shall make everything that I have commanded you.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen, dicens : Loquere filiis Israel, et dices ad eos : Sabbata mea custodite : quia signum est inter me et vos in generationibus vestris : ut sciatis quia ego Dominus qui sanctifico vos.
verses.english: And the Lord spoke to Moses, saying: "Speak to the children of Israel, and tell them: 'You must carefully observe My Sabbaths, because it is a sign between Me and you throughout your generations, so that you may know that I am the Lord who sanctifies you.'"

verses.latin: Custodite sabbatum : quia sanctum est vobis. Qui profanaverit illud, morte morietur : qui fecerit in eo opus, peribit anima illius de medio populi sui.
verses.english: You must keep the Sabbath holy, because it is consecrated to you. Whoever profanes it shall surely be put to death. Anyone who performs any work on it, that person's soul shall be cut off from among their people.

verses.latin: Sex diebus facietis opus : in die septimo sabbatum est, requies sancta Domino. Omnis qui fecerit opus in hac die, morietur.
verses.english: For six days you shall do your work, but on the seventh day is the Sabbath, a holy rest for the Lord. Anyone who does any work on this day shall die.

verses.latin: Custodiant filii Israel sabbatum, et celebrent illud in generationibus suis. Pactum est sempiternum inter me et filios Israel, et signum imperpetuum : quia in sex diebus fecit Dominus cælum et terram, et in septimo die cessavit ab opere, et respiravit.
verses.english: So the children of Israel must keep the Sabbath, and celebrate it throughout their generations. It is an everlasting covenant between Me and the children of Israel, and a perpetual sign: because in six days the Lord created the universe and the earth, and on the seventh day He rested from His work and refreshed Himself.

verses.latin: Videns autem populus quod moram faceret Moyses descendendi de monte, congregatus adversus Aaron, dixit: Surge, fac nobis deos, qui nos praecedant: Moyses enim hic vir, qui nos eduxit de terra Ægypti, nescimus quid ei acciderit.
verses.english: The people of Israel saw that Moses was taking a long time to come down from the mountain, so they gathered together against Aaron and said to him: "Stand up and make us gods to lead us, because as for this Moses, the man who led us out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has happened to him."

verses.latin: Dixitque ad eos Aaron: Auferte inaures aureas de uxorum et filiorum ac filiarum vestrarum auribus, et afferte mihi.
verses.english: Then Aaron said to them: "Take off the gold earrings from the ears of your wives, your sons, and your daughters, and bring them to me."

verses.latin: Fecitque omnis populus quod jusserat, deferens inaures ad Aaron.
verses.english: So all the people did as he commanded and brought their earrings to Aaron.

verses.latin: Quas cum accepisset de manibus eorum, formavit opere fusorio, et fecit inde vitulum conflatilem. Et dixerunt: Hi sunt dii tui, Israel, qui te eduxerunt de terra Ægypti.
verses.english: When he had received the gold from their hands, he formed it with a melting and shaping process and made a molten calf. Then they said: "These are your gods, O Israel, who led you out of the land of Egypt."

verses.latin: Videns autem Aaron, ædificavit altare coram eo, et præconis voce cunctis dixit: Cras solemnitas Domini est.
verses.english: When Aaron saw this, he built an altar in front of the calf. He then proclaimed in a loud voice to all the people: "Tomorrow is a feast day for the Lord God!"

verses.latin: Et surgentes mane, obtulerunt holocausta, et hostias pacificas: et sedit populus comedere ac bibere, et surrexerunt ludere.
verses.english: The next morning, the people rose early and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings. Then the people sat down to eat and drink, and afterward, they stood up to indulge in revelry.

verses.latin: Locutus est autem Dominus ad Moysen, dicens: Vade, descende: peccavit populus tuus, quem eduxisti de terra Ægypti.
verses.english: Then the Lord God spoke to Moses, saying: "Go down from the mountain! For your people, whom you led out of the land of Egypt, have sinned greatly."

verses.latin: Transgressi sunt cito de via, quam ostendisti eis: feceruntque sibi vitulum conflatilem, et adoraverunt, atque immolantes ei hostias, dixerunt: Hi sunt dii tui, Israel, qui te eduxerunt de terra Ægypti.
verses.english: They have quickly turned aside from the way that I showed them. They have made for themselves a molten calf, and they have worshipped it and offered sacrifices to it, saying: "These are your gods, O Israel, who led you out of the land of Egypt!"

verses.latin: Rursumque ait Dominus ad Moysen: Cerno quod populus iste duræ cervicis sit.
verses.english: And again the Lord God said to Moses: "I see that this people is stubborn and stiff-necked."

verses.latin: Dimitte me, ut irascatur furor meus contra eos, et deleam eos, faciamque te in gentem magnam.
verses.english: "Now, leave me alone, so that my burning wrath may rage against them, and I may destroy them. And I will make you into a great nation instead."

verses.latin: Moyses autem orabat Dominum Deum suum, dicens: Cur, Domine, irascitur furor tuus contra populum tuum, quem eduxisti de terra Ægypti in fortitudine magna, et in manu robusta?
verses.english: But Moses pleaded with the Lord his God, saying: "Why, O Lord, should your burning wrath rage against your own people, whom you led out of the land of Egypt with great power and with a strong hand?"

verses.latin: Ne, quæso, dicant Ægyptii: Callide eduxit eos, ut interficeret in montibus, et deleret de terra. Quiescat ira tua, et esto placabilis super nequitia populi tui.
verses.english: "Please do not let the Egyptians say: 'He cunningly led them out only to kill them in the mountains and destroy them from the face of the earth.' Let your anger subside, and be merciful regarding the evil of your people."

verses.latin: Recordare Abraham, Isaac, et Israel servorum tuorum, quibus jurasti per temetipsum, dicens: Multiplicabo semen vestrum sicut stellas cæli: et universam terram hanc, de qua locutus sum, dabo semini vestro, et possidebitis eam semper.
verses.english: "Remember Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, your servants, to whom you swore by your very self, saying: 'I will multiply your descendants like the stars of the sky, and all this land of which I have spoken, I will give to your descendants, and they will possess it forever.'"

verses.latin: Placatusque est Dominus ne faceret malum, quod locutus fuerat adversus populum suum.
verses.english: And the Lord God relented from doing the harm that He had threatened against His people.

verses.latin: Et Moyses reversus de monte, tenebat duas tabulas Testimonii in manu sua, scriptas utraque parte, et a priori et a posteriori.
verses.english: Moses then turned and came down from the mountain, holding the two tablets of the Testimony in his hand, inscribed on both sides, front and back.

verses.latin: Et digito Dei scriptæ erant, et cælatæ opere super tabulas.
verses.english: They were written by the very finger of God, and engraved with His work upon the tablets.

verses.latin: Audiens autem Josue vocem populi vociferantis, dixit ad Moysen: Ululatus pugnæ auditur in castris.
verses.english: When Joshua heard the sound of the people shouting, he said to Moses: "The sound of battle cries is heard in the camp!"

verses.latin: Qui respondit: Non est clamor adhortantium ad pugnam, neque vociferatio provocantium ad fugam: sed vocem cantantium ego audio.
verses.english: Moses replied: "That is not the sound of those encouraging a battle, nor the cry of those provoking flight. Rather, I hear the sound of singing."

verses.latin: Cumque appropinquasset ad castra, vidit vitulum et choros: iratusque valde, projecit de manu tabulas, et confregit eas ad radices montis.
verses.english: As he approached the camp, he saw the calf and the dancing. Enraged, he threw the tablets from his hands and smashed them at the foot of the mountain.

verses.latin: Arripiensque vitulum, quem fecerant, combussit, et contrivit usque ad pulverem: sparsitque in aquam, et dedit de ea potum filiis Israel.
verses.english: He then took the calf they had made, burned it with fire, and ground it into powder. He scattered the powder into water and made the children of Israel drink it.

verses.latin: Dixitque ad Aaron: Quid tibi fecit hic populus, ut induceres super eum peccatum maximum?
verses.english: And Moses said to Aaron: "What did this people do to you, that you brought such a great sin upon them?"

verses.latin: Cui ille respondit: Ne irascaris, domine mi: tu enim nosti populum, quod pronus sit ad malum.
verses.english: Aaron replied to him: "Do not be angry, my lord. For you yourself know this people, that they are prone to evil."

verses.latin: Dixeruntque mihi: Fac nobis deos, qui nos præcedant: Moyses enim hic vir, qui nos eduxit de terra Ægypti, nescimus quid illi acciderit.
verses.english: "They said to me: 'Make us gods to lead us, because as for this Moses, the man who led us out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has happened to him.'"

verses.latin: Et dixi eis: Quis vestrum habet aurum? Tulerunt, et dederunt mihi: et projeci in ignem, egressusque est hic vitulus.
verses.english: "So I said to them: 'Who among you has gold?' They took it off and gave it to me, and I threw it into the fire, and this calf came out!"

verses.latin: Videns ergo Moyses populum nudatum, spoliaverat enim eum Aaron turpitudine inter hostes suos, atque denudaverat.
verses.english: Moses then saw that the people were exposed and defenseless, for Aaron had stripped them bare and disgraced them before their enemies.

verses.latin: Et stans in porta castrorum, ait: Si quis est Domini, jungatur mihi. Et congregati sunt ad eum omnes filii Levi.
verses.english: So Moses stood at the entrance of the camp and said: "Whoever is for the Lord God, let him join me!" And all the sons of Levi gathered around him.

verses.latin: Quibus ait: Hæc dicit Dominus Deus Israel: Ponat unusquisque gladium super femur suum: ite, et redite de porta usque ad portam per media castra, et occidat unusquisque fratrem et amicum et proximum suum.
verses.english: He said to them: "Thus says the Lord God of Israel: 'Let each man put his sword on his thigh. Go back and forth from gate to gate throughout the camp, and let each man kill his brother, his friend, and his neighbor.'"

verses.latin: Feceruntque filii Levi juxta sermonem Moysi: cecideruntque in die illo quasi viginti tria millia hominum.
verses.english: And the sons of Levi did according to the word of Moses, and on that day, about twenty-three thousand men fell dead.

verses.latin: Dixitque Moyses: Consecrastis manus vestras hodie Domino, unusquisque in filio et in fratre suo, ut detur vobis benedictio.
verses.english: And Moses said: "You have consecrated yourselves today for the Lord God, each man against his own son and his own brother, so that a blessing may be given to you."

verses.latin: Facto autem altero die, locutus est Moyses ad populum: Peccastis peccatum maximum: ascendam ad Dominum, si quo modo possim orare pro scelere vestro.
verses.english: Now on the next day, Moses spoke to the people: "You have committed a very great sin. I will go up to the Lord God; perhaps I can make atonement for your wickedness."

verses.latin: Reversusque ad Dominum, ait: Obsecro, Domine, peccavit populus iste peccatum maximum, feceruntque sibi deos aureos.
verses.english: Then he returned to the Lord God and said: "Oh, Lord, I beg you, this people has committed a great sin, for they have made for themselves gods of gold!"

verses.latin: Aut dimitte eis hanc noxam, aut si non facis, dele me de libro tuo, quem scripsisti.
verses.english: "Now, either forgive them this guilt, or if you will not, then erase me from your book which you have written!"

verses.latin: Cui respondit Dominus: Qui peccaverit mihi, delebo eum de libro meo.
verses.english: The Lord God replied to him: "Whoever has sinned against me, him will I erase from my book."

verses.latin: Nunc igitur vade, et duc populum istum quo locutus sum tibi: angelus meus præcedet te. Ego enim in die ultionis visitabo et hoc peccatum eorum.
verses.english: "Now therefore, go and lead this people to the place of which I have spoken to you. My angel will go before you. For on the day of my vengeance, I will indeed punish them for this sin also."

verses.latin: Percussit ergo Dominus populum propter scelus, quod fecerant in vituli fabricatione, quem fecerat Aaron.
verses.english: So the Lord God struck the people with a plague because of the wickedness they had committed in making the calf, which Aaron had made.

verses.latin: Dixit quoque Dominus ad Moysen: Vade, ascende de loco isto, tu et populus tuus, quem eduxisti de terra Aegypti, ad terram quam juravi Abraham, Isaac et Jacob, dicens: Semini tuo dabo eam.
verses.english: The Lord also said to Moses: "Go up from this place—you and your people, whom you led out of the land of Egypt, to the land which I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying: 'To your offspring I will give it.'"

verses.latin: Et mittam præcursorem tui angelum, ut ejiciam Chananæum, et Amorrhæum, et Hethæum, et Pherezæum, et Hevæum, et Jebusæum,
verses.english: "And I will send an angel ahead of you to drive out the Canaanites, the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites,

verses.latin: ad terram fluentem lacte et melle: non enim ascendam tecum, quia populus dura cervice es: ne forte interficiam te in via.
verses.english: to a land flowing with milk and honey. But I will not go up with you, because you are a stiff-necked people—lest I destroy you on the way."

verses.latin: Auditoque sermone hoc pessimo, luxit populus, et nemo indutus est cultu suo.
verses.english: When the people heard this very harsh message, they mourned, and no one put on their ornaments of joy.

verses.latin: Et dixit Dominus ad Moysen: Loquere filiis Israël: Populus dura cervice es: semel ascendam in medio tui, et delebo te. Nunc depone cultum tuum ex te, ut sciam quid faciam tibi.
verses.english: And the Lord said to Moses: "Speak to the children of Israel: 'You are a stiff-necked people. If I were to go up among you for even one moment, I would destroy you. Now take off your ornaments, so that I may know what I will do to you.'"

verses.latin: Deposuerunt ergo filii Israël cultum suum juxta montem Horeb.
verses.english: So the children of Israel removed their ornaments from themselves near Mount Horeb.

verses.latin: Moyses quoque, tollens tabernaculum, fixit extra castra procul, vocavitque illud, Tabernaculum fœderis. Et omnis qui quærebat Dominum, egrediebatur ad tabernaculum fœderis, extra castra.
verses.english: Moses also took the tabernacle and pitched it outside the camp, far away, and called it "the Tent of Meeting" — or "Tabernacle of the Covenant". And everyone who sought the Lord would go out to the Tent of Meeting, which was outside the camp.

verses.latin: Cumque egrederetur Moyses ad tabernaculum, surgebat omnis populus, et stabat unusquisque in ostio papilionis sui, aspiciebantque tergum Moysi, donec ingrederetur tabernaculum.
verses.english: And when Moses went out to the tabernacle, all the people would rise and stand, each at the entrance of his own tent, and watch Moses' back until he entered the tabernacle.

verses.latin: Cumque ingressus esset Moyses tabernaculum fœderis, descendebat columna nubis, et stabat ad ostium tabernaculi, loquebaturque cum Moyse.
verses.english: And when Moses had entered the Tent of Meeting, the pillar of cloud would descend and stand at the entrance of the tabernacle, and the Lord would speak with Moses.

verses.latin: Cunctique videbant columnam nubis stantem ad ostium tabernaculi. Et stabant omnes, adorabantque per ostia papilionum suorum.
verses.english: All the people saw the pillar of cloud standing at the entrance of the tabernacle. And all stood and worshipped, each at the entrance of their own tents.

verses.latin: Loquebatur autem Dominus ad Moysen facie ad faciem, sicut loqui solet homo ad amicum suum. Cumque reverteretur in castra, minister ejus Josue filius Nun, juvenis, non recedebat de tabernaculo.
verses.english: Now the Lord spoke to Moses face to face, just as a person speaks to a friend. When Moses returned to the camp, his assistant Joshua, the son of Nun, a young man, would not depart from the tabernacle.

verses.latin: Et ait Moyses ad Dominum: Ecce præcipis mihi ut educam populum istum: et nescio quem missurus sis mecum. Dixisti quoque: Novi te ex nomine, et invenisti gratiam coram me.
verses.english: And Moses said to the Lord: "See, You are commanding me to lead out this people, yet You have not let me know whom You will send with me. You have also said: 'I know you by name, and you have found favor with Me.'"

verses.latin: Si ergo inveni gratiam in conspectu tuo, ostende mihi faciem tuam, ut sciam te, et inveniam gratiam ante oculos tuos: respice populum tuum, hanc gentem tuam.
verses.english: "If, therefore, I have found favor in Your sight, show me Your presence, so that I may know You and continue to find favor in Your eyes. Consider this people—Your very own nation."

verses.latin: Et ait: Facies mea præcedet te, et requiem dabo tibi.
verses.english: And the Lord said: "My presence shall go before you, and I will give you rest."

verses.latin: Et Moyses: Si non tu ipse præcedis, ne educas nos de loco isto.
verses.english: And Moses replied: "If You Your very self do not go before us, do not lead us up from this place."

verses.latin: In quo enim scire poterimus nos, et familia tua, invenisse gratiam in conspectu tuo, nisi si ambulaveris nobiscum? ut magnifice honorificemur ab omnibus populis, qui habitant super terram.
verses.english: "For by what shall it be known that I and Your family—Your people—have found favor in Your sight, unless You walk with us? This is how we will be greatly honored by all the peoples who dwell upon the earth."

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen: Etiam sermonem istum, quem locutus es, faciam: invenisti enim gratiam coram me, et te ipsum novi ex nomine.
verses.english: And the Lord said to Moses: "Even this very request that you have spoken, I will do; for you have found favor before Me, and I know you by name."

verses.latin: Et ait Moyses: Ostende mihi gloriam tuam.
verses.english: And Moses said: "Show me Your glory!"

verses.latin: Respondit: Ego ostendam omne bonum tibi, et proclamabo in nomine Domini coram te: et miserebor cui voluero, et clemens ero in quem mihi placuerit.
verses.english: The Lord responded: "I Myself will make all My goodness pass before you, and I will proclaim the name of the Lord before you. I will have mercy on whom I will have mercy, and I will show compassion on whom I please."

verses.latin: Et rursum: Non poteris videre faciem meam: non enim videbit me homo, et vivet.
verses.english: And again He said: "You cannot see My divine presence, for no human being can see Me and live."

verses.latin: Et iterum: Ecce, est locus apud me, et stabis super petram.
verses.english: And again He said: "Behold, there is a place near Me, and you shall stand upon the rock."

verses.latin: Cumque transierit gloria mea, ponam te in foramine petræ, et protegam dextera mea, donec transeam.
verses.english: "And when My glory passes by, I will put you in a cleft of the rock, and I will cover you with My hand until I have passed by."

verses.latin: Et auferam manum meam, et videbis posteriora mea: faciem autem meam videre non poteris.
verses.english: "Then I will take away My hand, and you will see My back—meaning My after-effect or the manifestation of My presence after I have passed—but My divine presence you cannot see."

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad eum: Sculpe tibi duas tabulas lapideas, sicut priores fuerunt: et scribam super eas verba, quae habuerunt priores tabulae, quas confregisti.
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses: 'Hew two stone tablets for yourself, exactly like the first ones were, and I will write upon them the exact same words that were on the first tablets, the ones you broke.'

verses.latin: Esto paratus mane, ut ascendas statim in montem Sinai: et stabis mecum in vertice montis.
verses.english: Be ready in the morning, so you can immediately ascend Mount Sinai and stand with Me at the very summit of the mountain.

verses.latin: Nullus ascendat tecum, et nemo appareat per totum montem: boves quoque, et oves non pascantur contra illum montem.
verses.english: No one else is to ascend with you, and no one else is to be seen anywhere on the mountain. Furthermore, no cattle or sheep are to graze facing that mountain.

verses.latin: Exciderat ergo duas tabulas lapideas, quales antea fuerant: et de nocte consurgens, ascendit in montem Sinai, sicut ei præceperat Dominus, portans secum tabulas.
verses.english: So Moses hewed two stone tablets, just like the previous ones had been. Rising early in the night, he ascended Mount Sinai, exactly as the Lord had commanded him, carrying the tablets with him.

verses.latin: Cumque descendisset Dominus per nubem, stetit Moyses cum eo, invocans nomen Domini.
verses.english: And when the Lord descended in the cloud, Moses stood with Him, calling upon the very Name of the Lord.

verses.latin: Quo transeunte coram eo, ait: Dominus, Dominus Deus, misericors et clemens, patiens et multæ miserationis, ac verax,
verses.english: As He passed by Moses, He declared: 'The Lord, the Lord God—He is full of mercy and tenderness, ever-patient, abounding in steadfast love, and perfectly truthful.'

verses.latin: qui custodis misericordiam in millia, et aufers iniquitatem, et scelera, et peccata, nullusque apud te per se innocens est, qui reddis iniquitatem patrum in filios filiorumque in tertiam et quartam generationem.
verses.english: —He who keeps mercy for thousands of generations, and takes away wickedness, and crimes, and all sins, though no one is inherently innocent before Him—He who repays the iniquity of the fathers upon the children, and the children's children, even to the third and fourth generation.

verses.latin: Festinus Moyses curvatus est pronus in terram, et adorans
verses.english: Moses immediately bowed down to the ground, prostrating himself, and worshipped God,

verses.latin: ait: Si inveni gratiam in conspectu tuo, Domine, obsecro ut ambules nobiscum (populus est durae cervicis) et auferas iniquitates nostras, et peccata nostra, nosque possideas.
verses.english: saying, 'If I have found favor in Your sight, Lord, I beg you to walk among us—even though Your people are stubborn and rebellious—and take away our iniquities and our sins, and make us Your very own possession.'

verses.latin: Respondit: Ego inibo pactum tecum coram cunctis. Faciam signa, quæ nunquam sunt facta super terram, nec in ullis gentibus: ut cernat populus iste, in cuius medio es, opera Domini tremenda, quæ facturus sum.
verses.english: The Lord answered: 'I will now enter into a solemn covenant with you before all of your people. I will perform wonders that have never before been done on the earth, nor among any other nation, so that this people, in whose midst you live, may see the awe-inspiring works of the Lord that I am about to do.'

verses.latin: Observa universa quæ mando tibi hodie: Ego ipse ejiciam ante faciem tuam Amorrhaeum, et Chananaeum, et Hethæum, et Pherezaeum, et Hevæum, et Jebusæum.
verses.english: Observe all that I am commanding you today: I myself will drive out from before you the Amorites, and the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and the Hivites, and the Jebusites.

verses.latin: Cave ne unquam cum habitatoribus terræ illius ineas foedus, qui postea tibi sint in ruinam: sed aras eorum destrue, confringe statuas, et lucos cæde.
verses.english: Be careful never to make a covenant with the inhabitants of that land, lest they later become your ruin. Instead, you must destroy their altars, break their sacred pillars, and cut down their pagan groves.

verses.latin: Nec adorabis deum alienum: Dominus enim Zelotes nomen suum, Deus æmulator est.
verses.english: You are not to worship any foreign god; for the Lord, whose very Name is 'Jealous God,' is a God who demands absolute devotion.

verses.latin: Ne forte ineas pactum cum hominibus regionum illarum: et cum fornicati fuerint cum diis suis, et adoraverint simulacra eorum, vocet te aliquis ut comedas de immolatis.
verses.english: Do not by any means make a covenant with the people of those regions, because when they commit spiritual fornication with their gods, and worship their idols, someone might call you to eat from their sacrifices.

verses.latin: Nec uxorem de filiabus eorum accipies filiis tuis: ne cum ipsæ fornicatæ fuerint, fornicari faciant et filios tuos in deos suos.
verses.english: Nor are you to take wives for your sons from among their daughters, lest when those women commit spiritual fornication, they also cause your sons to commit spiritual fornication with their gods.

verses.latin: Deos conflatiles non facies tibi.
verses.english: You are not to make for yourselves any molten gods.

verses.latin: Solemnitatem azymorum custodies. Septem diebus vesceris azymis, sicut præcepi tibi in tempore mensis novarum: mense enim verni temporis egressus es de Ægypto.
verses.english: You are to keep the Feast of Unleavened Bread. For seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, just as I commanded you at the appointed time in the month of Abib—the month of new crops—for it was in the springtime that you came out of Egypt.

verses.latin: Omne, quod aperit vulvam masculini sexus, meum erit: de cunctis animantibus tam de bubus, quam de ovibus, tuum erit masculinum.
verses.english: Every firstborn male that opens the womb is Mine. Of all the livestock, both cattle and sheep, every firstborn male is to be consecrated to Me.

verses.latin: Primitivum asini mutabis ovem: et si non redemeris, occides. Omne primogenitum filiorum tuorum redimes, et non apparebis in conspectu meo vacuus.
verses.english: The firstborn of a donkey you shall ransom with a lamb; but if you do not ransom it, then you must break its neck. Every firstborn of your sons you shall ransom, and you are not to appear before My presence empty-handed.

verses.latin: Sex diebus operaberis, in septimo die cessabis arare et metere.
verses.english: You shall labor for six days, but on the seventh day you shall cease from plowing and from harvesting.

verses.latin: Solemnitatem hebdomadarum custodies in primitiis frugum tuarum spicarum, et solemnitatem quando redeunte anno cuncta conduntur.
verses.english: You are to keep the Feast of Weeks, which is the feast of the first fruits of your wheat harvest, and also the Feast of Ingathering, which occurs at the turn of the year when all the crops are gathered in.

verses.latin: Ter in anno apparebit omnis masculus tuus in conspectu Domini Dei Israel.
verses.english: Three times in a year, every male among you shall appear before the presence of the Lord, the God of Israel.

verses.latin: Cum enim ejecero gentes a facie tua, et dilatavero terminos tuos: nemo insidiabitur terræ tuæ, quando ascendes, et apparebis in conspectu Domini Dei tui ter in anno.
verses.english: For when I have driven out the nations from before you and enlarged your territories, no one will plot against your land when you ascend and appear before the presence of the Lord your God three times in a year.

verses.latin: Non immolabis super fermento sanguinem victimæ meæ, nec remanebit in mane de agno Paschæ.
verses.english: You shall not offer the blood of My sacrifice with leavened bread, nor shall any part of the Paschal lamb remain until morning.

verses.latin: Non coques hædum in lacte matris suæ.
verses.english: You shall not boil a young goat in its mother's milk.

verses.latin: Dixitque Dominus ad Moysen: Scribe tibi verba hæc, quibus et tecum, et cum Israel pepigi foedus.
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses: 'Write these words for yourself, for it is by these very words that I have made a covenant with you and with Israel.'

verses.latin: Fuit ergo ibi cum Domino quadraginta diebus et quadraginta noctibus: non comedet panem, et aquam non bibit: et scripsit in tabulis verba foederis decem.
verses.english: So Moses was there with the Lord for forty days and forty nights. He ate no bread and drank no water. And on the tablets, God Himself wrote the ten words of the covenant—the Ten Commandments.

verses.latin: Cumque descenderet Moyses de monte Sinai, habens duas tabulas testimonii, et ignoraret quod cornuta esset facies sua ex consortio sermonis Domini:
verses.english: Now when Moses came down from Mount Sinai, holding the two tablets of the Testimony—the covenant—he did not know that his face was emitting rays of light from his intimate communion with the Lord.

verses.latin: videntes Aaron et filii Israel faciem Moysi cornutam, timuerunt prope accedere.
verses.english: Aaron and the children of Israel saw that Moses' face was emitting rays of light, and they were afraid to approach him closely.

verses.latin: Vocavitque eos Moyses, et reversi sunt ad eum Aaron et principes multitudinis. Et postquam locutus est,
verses.english: But Moses called them, so Aaron and the leaders of the assembly returned to him. And after he spoke to them,

verses.latin: accesserunt ad eum omnes filii Israel: quibus præcepit cuncta quæ audierat a Domino in monte Sinai.
verses.english: all the children of Israel came near to him, and he commanded them all the things he had heard from the Lord on Mount Sinai.

verses.latin: Impletisque sermonibus, posuit velamen super faciem suam.
verses.english: And after he had finished speaking all the words, he put a veil over his face.

verses.latin: Cum intraret Moyses ad Dominum, ut loqueretur cum eo, auferret velamen, donec exiret, et egrediens loquebatur ad filios Israel omnia quæ sibi fuerant imperata.
verses.english: Whenever Moses went in before the Lord to speak with Him, he would remove the veil until he came out. And when he came out, he would speak to the children of Israel all that had been commanded to him.

verses.latin: Qui videbant faciem Moysi egredientis, esse cornutam, et operiebat rursus faciem suam, donec ingrederetur loqui ad eum.
verses.english: The children of Israel would see that Moses' face, as he came out, was emitting rays of light, and so he would put the veil over his face again until he went in to speak with the Lord.

verses.latin: Qui videbant faciem Moysi egredientis, esse cornutam, et operiebat rursus faciem suam, donec ingrederetur loqui ad eum.
verses.english: The children of Israel would see that Moses' face, as he came out, was emitting rays of light, and so he would put the veil over his face again until he went in to speak with the Lord.
