verses.latin: Congregatisque Moyses omni multitudine filiorum Israel, dixit ad eos: Hæc sunt verba quæ locutus est Dominus ut faciatis:
verses.english: Moses then called together all the people of Israel and he told them: “Here are the things that God has commanded you to do:”

verses.latin: Sex diebus operabimini: septimus dies erit sanctus vobis, sabbatum et requies Domini. Qui fecerit in eo opus, morietur.
verses.english: “You are to work for six days, but the seventh day will be holy for you. It is the Sabbath, a day of rest for the Lord. Anyone who does any work on that day will be put to death.”

verses.latin: Non accendetis ignem in omnibus habitaculis vestris per diem sabbati.
verses.english: “You must not light any fire in any of your homes on the Sabbath day.”

verses.latin: Et ait Moyses ad omnem multitudinem filiorum Israel: Iste est sermo, quem præcepit Dominus, dicens:
verses.english: Moses then spoke to all the people of Israel again, saying: “These are the commands that God has given you:”

verses.latin: Tollite de vobis primitias Domino. Omnis prompti animi et voluntarius offerat eas Domino, aurum, et argentum, et æs,
verses.english: “Set aside a sacred offering for the Lord. Everyone who is willing and eager to give with a generous heart should bring the Lord’s offering of gold, silver, bronze,”

verses.latin: hyacinthum et purpuram, coccumque bis tinctum, et byssum, et pilos caprarum,
verses.english: “blue fabric, purple fabric, scarlet fabric, fine linen, goat hair,”

verses.latin: et pelles arietum rubricatas, et pelles hyacinthinas, et ligna setim,
verses.english: “ram skins dyed red, fine leather, acacia wood,”

verses.latin: et oleum ad luminaria concinnanda, et aromata in unguentum, et thymiama suavissimi odoris,
verses.english: “oil for the lamps, spices for the anointing oil and for the sweet-smelling incense,”

verses.latin: et onychinos lapides, et gemmas ad ornanda superhumerale et rationale.
verses.english: “and onyx stones and other jewels to be set into the High Priest’s ephod and breastplate.”

verses.latin: Omnis sapiens corde vestro veniat, et faciat quod jussit Dominus:
verses.english: “Every skilled craftsman among you should come and make everything that the Lord has commanded for the Tabernacle:”

verses.latin: tabernaculum, et tectum ejus, et operimentum, anulos, et tabulas, vectes, et columnas, ac bases,
verses.english: “the Tabernacle itself, its outer tent, its covering, the metal rings, the wooden frames, the crossbars, the pillars, and their bases,”

verses.latin: arcam, et vectes, propitiatorium, et velum quod ante illud appenditur,
verses.english: “the Ark of the Covenant, its carrying poles, the Ark’s lid (the Mercy Seat), and the curtain that hangs in front of it,”

verses.latin: mensam cum vectibus, et vasis, et propositio panum,
verses.english: “the table for the Bread of the Presence, its carrying poles, all its utensils, and the Bread of the Presence itself,”

verses.latin: candelabrum ad luminaria sustentanda, vasa illius, et lucernas, et oleum ad nutrimenta luminum,
verses.english: “the lampstand for light, its accessories, its lamps, and the oil for lighting,”

verses.latin: altare thymiamatis, et vectes, et oleum unctionis, et thymiama compositum: ostium tabernaculi, et velum in introitu ejus,
verses.english: “the altar of incense, its carrying poles, the anointing oil, the fragrant incense, and the curtain for the entrance to the Tabernacle,”

verses.latin: altare holocausti, et craticulam æneam, vectes, et vasa ejus omnia: labrum, et basim ejus,
verses.english: “the altar for burnt offerings, its bronze grating, its carrying poles, and all its utensils; the basin and its stand,”

verses.latin: cortinas atrii, et columnas, bases, et velum in introitu atrii,
verses.english: “the curtains for the courtyard, its pillars, their bases, and the curtain for the entrance to the courtyard,”

verses.latin: paxillos tabernaculi, et atrii cum funiculis suis.
verses.english: “the pegs for the Tabernacle and the courtyard, along with their ropes.”

verses.latin: Vestes, quibus utuntur in ministerio sanctuarii, vestes sacras Aaron pontificis, et filiorum ejus, ut sacerdotio fungantur Domino.
verses.english: “Also the beautifully woven priestly garments that will be used for ministering in the Holy Place: the sacred garments for Aaron, the High Priest, and the garments for his sons, so they can serve God as priests.”

verses.latin: Et egressa est omnis multitudo filiorum Israel a facie Moysi.
verses.english: After Moses finished speaking, all the people of Israel departed from him.

verses.latin: Et ingressi sunt universi, quorum attonitus fuit animus, et sponte et prompto animo obtulerunt primitias Domino in opera tabernaculi testimonii, et ad vestes sanctas.
verses.english: Then everyone whose heart was stirred and whose spirit was willing came and brought their offerings to the Lord for the work of the Tent of Meeting, which contained the Covenant, and for all the holy priestly garments.

verses.latin: Viris ac mulieribus: attulerunt armillas, et inaures, et anulos, et dextralia, omne vas aureum, in donaria Domini. Quicumque potuit offerre oblationem auri, obtulit.
verses.english: Both men and women came. They brought brooches, earrings, rings, bracelets—every kind of gold object. Anyone who was able to bring an offering of gold for the Lord brought it.

verses.latin: Si quis habebat hyacinthum, et purpuram, coccumque bis tinctum, et byssum, et pilos caprarum, pellesque arietum rubricatas, et hyacinthinas, attulit.
verses.english: And everyone who possessed blue fabric, purple fabric, scarlet fabric, fine linen, goat hair, red-dyed ram skins, or fine leather brought them.

verses.latin: Aurum et argentum et æs, quicumque de his habuerant, obtulerunt Domino. Ligna quoque setim ad diversos usus.
verses.english: Everyone who was able to offer silver or bronze brought it as an offering to the Lord. And everyone who had acacia wood for any purpose brought it.

verses.latin: Omnes mulieres sapientes corde, fecerunt et texuerunt hyacinthum, et purpuram, et coccum bis tinctum, et byssum.
verses.english: All the women who were skilled in weaving crafted and spun the blue fabric, purple fabric, scarlet fabric, and fine linen.

verses.latin: Et dederunt pilos caprarum, studio mentis suæ.
verses.english: And all the women whose hearts were willing spun the goat hair.

verses.latin: Principes vero obtulerunt onychinos lapides, et gemmas ad superhumerale et rationale,
verses.english: The leaders of the tribes brought onyx stones and other jewels for the ephod and the breastplate,

verses.latin: et aromata, et oleum ad luminaria concinnanda, et ad unguendum, et thymiama componendum.
verses.english: along with spices and oil for the lamps, for the anointing oil, and for the fragrant incense.

verses.latin: Omnes viri et mulieres mente prompta obtulerunt dona, ut fierent opera, quæ jusserat Dominus per manum Moysi.
verses.english: All the men and women whose hearts willingly prompted them brought their gifts to the Lord, so that the work that God had commanded through Moses could be done.

verses.latin: Dixitque Moyses ad filios Israel: Ecce, nominavit Dominus ex nomine Beseleel filium Uri filii Hur de tribu Juda.
verses.english: Then Moses said to the people of Israel: “Look, God has specifically called by name Bezalel, the son of Uri, the son of Hur, from the tribe of Judah.”

verses.latin: Implevit eum spiritu Dei, sapientia, et intelligentia, et scientia in omni opere,
verses.english: “God has filled him with the Spirit of God, giving him great wisdom, understanding, and knowledge in every kind of craft.”

verses.latin: ad excogitandum, et faciendum opus ex auro, et argento, et ære,
verses.english: “He has given him the ability to design and create works of art using gold, silver, and bronze;”

verses.latin: et celandum marmor, et diversorum operum fabriles curas.
verses.english: “to engrave stones and set them, to carve wood, and to work in every type of skilled craftsmanship.”

verses.latin: Et dedit in corde ejus ut doceret: ipsum, et Ooliab filium Achisamech de tribu Dan.
verses.english: “God has also put it in his heart, and in the heart of Oholiab, son of Ahisamach, from the tribe of Dan, to teach others these skills.”

verses.latin: Ambos erudivit sapientia, ut faciant omne opus cælatum, et textorum, ac plumariorum, de hyacintho, et purpura, coccoque bis tincto, et bysso, et omnia texentium, et nova quæque reperiendum.
verses.english: “He has endowed both of them with exceptional wisdom and skill to perform every kind of artistic work—such as engraving, weaving, and embroidering with blue fabric, purple fabric, scarlet fabric, and fine linen, and to weave any kind of cloth, and to discover all sorts of new crafts.”

verses.latin: Igitur Beseleel et Ooliab et omnis vir sapiens, quibus dedit Dominus sapientiam et intellectum, ut scirent fabrefacere opere cultu sanctuarii, fecerunt omnia quæ præceperat Dominus.
verses.english: So Bezalel, Oholiab, and every skilled craftsman—to whom the Lord had given wisdom and understanding so they would know how to perform all the work for the holy sanctuary—they did everything the Lord had commanded.

verses.latin: Cumque vocasset Moyses Beseleel et Ooliab et omnem virum sapientem, cui dederat Deus sapientiam, et qui sponte sua offerentes venerant ad faciendum opus,
verses.english: Then Moses called Bezalel, Oholiab, and every wise man whom God had gifted with wisdom, and all those who willingly came forward to perform the work.

verses.latin: reddiderat eis omnem pecuniam, et quidquid in donariis obtulerant filii Israël ad faciendum sanctuarium. Qui cum per singulos dies mane redderent vota sua,
verses.english: Moses gave back to them all the funds and everything that the children of Israel had offered as gifts to construct the sanctuary. Yet, every single morning, the people continued to bring their offerings,

verses.latin: venerunt artifices, qui erant occupati in opere sanctuarii,
verses.english: so the craftsmen who were engaged in the work of the sanctuary came forward.

verses.latin: et dixerunt Moysi: Plus offert populus quam necesse est.
verses.english: They said to Moses, "The people are offering more than what is needed."

verses.latin: Præcepit ergo Moyses, et misit in præconium, dicens: Ultra ne offerant vir, aut mulier quidquam in opus sanctuarii. Sicque cessatum est a muneribus offerendis,
verses.english: So Moses gave a command and sent out a proclamation, saying, "Let no man or woman offer anything more for the work of the sanctuary!" This is how the people were stopped from bringing gifts,

verses.latin: eo quod oblata sufficerent, et superabundarent.
verses.english: because what had already been offered was sufficient and even superabundant.

verses.latin: Feceruntque omnes corde sapientes ad explendum opus tabernaculi, cortinas decem de bysso retorta, et hyacintho, et purpura, coccoque bis tincto, opere vario, et arte polymita.
verses.english: All the craftsmen who were wise of heart then began to complete the work of the tabernacle. They made ten curtains from fine twisted linen, blue fabric, purple fabric, and scarlet fabric dyed twice, crafted with varied and intricate artistic work.

verses.latin: Unius cortinæ longitudo habebat viginti octo cubitos, et latitudo quatuor: unam mensuram habebant omnes cortinæ.
verses.english: Each curtain was twenty-eight cubits long and four cubits wide; all the curtains had the same measurement.

verses.latin: Junxitque cortinas quinque alteri, et quinque alias sibi.
verses.english: So they joined five of the curtains to one another, and the other five they also joined to one another.

verses.latin: Fecitque ansulas hyacinthinas in extremis utriusque cortinæ, ex utraque parte, pro continuatione.
verses.english: They also made loops of blue material at the edge of each of the five connected curtains, on both sides, for joining them together.

verses.latin: Quinquagenas in cortina una, et quinquagenas in altera, contra se invicem respicientes.
verses.english: There were fifty loops on one curtain set and fifty loops on the other, facing each other.

verses.latin: Fecitque circulos aureos quinquaginta, quibus cortinarum jungeretur fimbria, ut unum tabernaculum fieret.
verses.english: They made fifty golden clasps by which the edges of the curtains were joined, so that the tabernacle would become one unified structure.

verses.latin: Fecit et saga undecim de pilis caprarum, ad operiendum tectum tabernaculi.
verses.english: They also made eleven curtains from goats' hair to cover the roof of the tabernacle.

verses.latin: Longitudinem unius sagæ habebat cubitos triginta, et latitudo ejus quatuor: unius mensuræ erant omnes sagæ.
verses.english: Each curtain was thirty cubits long and four cubits wide; all the curtains had the same measurement.

verses.latin: Quas quinque separatim, et sex alias junxit sibi.
verses.english: They joined five of these curtains by themselves, and the other six they joined by themselves.

verses.latin: Fecitque ansulas quinquagenas in extrema parte sagæ unius, et quinquagenas in extrema parte sagæ alterius, ut jungerentur sibi.
verses.english: They made fifty loops at the extreme edge of one set of joined curtains, and fifty loops at the extreme edge of the other set, so that they could be joined together.

verses.latin: Et circulos æneos quinquaginta, quibus tegumenti jungi possent ansulæ, ut unum fieret operimentum.
verses.english: They also made fifty bronze clasps, by which the loops of the covering could be joined, so that it would become one unified covering.

verses.latin: Fecit et operimenta tabernaculi de pellibus arietum rubricatis, et aliud desuper tegumentum de pellibus hyacinthinis.
verses.english: They also made coverings for the tabernacle from rams' skins dyed red, and another covering above that, made from blue skins.

verses.latin: Fecit et tabulas tabernaculi de lignis setim stantes.
verses.english: They also made upright boards for the tabernacle from acacia wood.

verses.latin: Decem cubitos tenebat longitudo tabulæ unius, et cubitum ac semissem latitudo.
verses.english: The length of each board was ten cubits, and its width was one and a half cubits.

verses.latin: Binos tigillos per singulas tabulas, qui alterum alteri jungerentur: sic fecit in omnibus tabulis tabernaculi.
verses.english: Each board had two tenons to connect one to the other; they made them this way for all the boards of the tabernacle.

verses.latin: Viginti tabulas ad plagam australem, quæ respicit meridiem.
verses.english: They made twenty boards for the south side, which faces the south.

verses.latin: Quadraginta bases argenteas sub singulis tabulis, binæ scilicet bases sub singulis tigillis.
verses.english: They made forty silver bases under each of the twenty boards—specifically, two bases under each tenon.

verses.latin: Ad plagam tabernaculi quæ vergit ad aquilonem, fecit viginti tabulas,
verses.english: For the north side of the tabernacle, they made twenty boards.

verses.latin: et quadraginta bases argenteas: binas bases sub singulis tabulis.
verses.english: And they made forty silver bases, two bases under each board.

verses.latin: Ad occidentalem vero plagam tabernaculi, fecit sex tabulas.
verses.english: For the western side of the tabernacle, they made six boards.

verses.latin: Et duas tabulas in angulis posterioribus tabernaculi,
verses.english: And they made two boards for the back corners of the tabernacle,

verses.latin: quæ junctæ erant deorsum usque sursum, et in unum nexum pariter coaptatæ. Sic fecit ex utraque parte per angulos,
verses.english: which were joined together from the bottom all the way to the top, and fitted into a single connection. They made them this way on both sides for the corners,

verses.latin: ut octo essent simul tabulæ, et bases argenteæ sedecim, binæ scilicet bases sub singulis tabulis.
verses.english: so that there were eight boards in total, and sixteen silver bases, meaning two bases under each board.

verses.latin: Fecit et vectes de lignis setim, quinque ad continendas tabulas unius lateris tabernaculi,
verses.english: They also made bars of acacia wood: five bars for holding together the boards on one side of the tabernacle,

verses.latin: et quinque alios ad alterius lateris tabulas coaptandos, quinque quoque ad occidentalem plagam tabernaculi retrorsum.
verses.english: five others for fitting to the boards of the other side, and also five for the western side of the tabernacle at the back.

verses.latin: Et alium vectem per medias tabulas, qui a summo pertingeretur usque ad summum.
verses.english: They also made a central bar running through the middle of the boards, extending from one end to the other.

verses.latin: Tabulasque ipsas aureis laminis vestivit, et fusis argenteis bases earum, et anulos aureos per quos vectes ferri possent. Ipsos quoque vectes laminis aureis tectos.
verses.english: And they covered the boards themselves with sheets of gold, and made their bases of cast silver, and made golden rings through which the bars could be passed. The bars themselves were also covered with sheets of gold.

verses.latin: Fecit et velum de hyacintho, purpura, coccoque bis tincto, et bysso retorta, opere polymitario, et arte contextum.
verses.english: They also made a veil from blue fabric, purple fabric, and scarlet fabric dyed twice, and fine twisted linen, woven with intricate artistic work and skillful craft.

verses.latin: Et quatuor columnas de lignis setim, quas vestivit auro, et basibus earum argenteis. Uncini vero earum aurei erant.
verses.english: And they made four columns from acacia wood, which they covered with gold, and their bases were made of silver. Their hooks, however, were made of gold.

verses.latin: Fecit et in introitu tabernaculi tentorium de hyacintho, et purpura, coccoque bis tincto, et bysso retorta, opere plumario.
verses.english: They also made a curtain for the entrance of the tabernacle, from blue fabric, purple fabric, scarlet fabric dyed twice, and fine twisted linen, all woven with needlework.

verses.latin: Et columnas quinque, cum basibus suis, quas operuit auro: et capitella earum, et scalpturas auri. Quinque quoque bases argenteas.
verses.english: And they made five columns with their bases, which they covered with gold; their capitals and the decorative carvings were also gold. They also made five silver bases for these columns.

verses.latin: Fecit autem Beseleel et arcam de lignis setim, duorum cubitorum et dimidii longitudinis, et cubiti et dimidii latitudinis, et altitudinis similiter cubiti unius et dimidii.
verses.english: Now, Bezalel constructed the Ark of the Covenant using acacia wood. Its length was two and a half cubits, its width was one and a half cubits, and its height was also one and a half cubits.

verses.latin: Et vestivit eam auro purissimo intus et foris: fecitque in ea coronam auream per circuitum.
verses.english: He then overlaid the Ark, both inside and out, with pure gold. He also made a decorative molding of gold that went all around its top edge.

verses.latin: Et quatuor circulos aureos fudit per singulos angulos: duos scilicet in latere uno, et duos in altero.
verses.english: He cast four gold rings and fastened them to each of the four corners—two rings on one side and two on the opposite side.

verses.latin: Perticas quoque de lignis setim, quas vestivit auro.
verses.english: He also made carrying poles from acacia wood, which he then overlaid with gold.

verses.latin: Et immisit in circulos, qui erant in lateribus arcae, ad portandum eam.
verses.english: He inserted these poles into the rings on the sides of the Ark, so it could be carried.

verses.latin: Fecit et propitiatorium de auro purissimo, duorum cubitorum et dimidii longitudinis, et cubiti unius et dimidii latitudinis.
verses.english: He also made the Mercy Seat out of pure gold. It was two and a half cubits long and one and a half cubits wide.

verses.latin: Duos quoque cherubim ex auro productiles, coaptavit ex utraque parte propitiatorii.
verses.english: He crafted two cherubim from hammered pure gold, placing one at each end of the Mercy Seat.

verses.latin: Cherubim unum ex hac parte, et alterum ex illa. Ex ipso propitiatorio facies suas extendentes, et alas expandentes, et operientes propitiatorium, seque mutuo respicientes.
verses.english: One cherub was on one end, and the other cherub on the opposite end. Their faces were turned towards each other, their wings were spread out over the Mercy Seat, and they were looking down at it, forming a unified piece with the Mercy Seat itself.

verses.latin: Fecit et mensam de lignis setim, duorum cubitorum longitudinis, et cubiti unius latitudinis, et cubiti unius ac dimidii altitudinis.
verses.english: He also constructed the Table of the Presence using acacia wood. It was two cubits long, one cubit wide, and one and a half cubits high.

verses.latin: Et circumcinxit auro purissimo: fecitque illi coronam auream per circuitum.
verses.english: He covered the table with pure gold and fashioned a gold molding around its edge.

verses.latin: Et labium ipsius, quatuor digitis latum, vestivit auro: fecitque illi coronam auream supra labium.
verses.english: He made a rim for the table, four fingers wide, and overlaid it with gold. Above this rim, he added another gold molding.

verses.latin: Quatuorque circulos aureos fudit, et posuit per singulos angulos, qui in latere erant mensae pro pedibus.
verses.english: He cast four gold rings and attached them to the four corners of the table, next to its legs.

verses.latin: Juxta coronam inferius erant circuli, ut mittantur in eos vectes, et possit mensa portari.
verses.english: These rings were positioned near the lower molding so that poles could be inserted through them to carry the table.

verses.latin: Ipsosque vectes de lignis setim vestivit auro.
verses.english: He made these carrying poles from acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.

verses.latin: Fecit et candelabrum septiforme de auro purissimo, productilibus. Omne opus de auro perductum atque formatum erat.
verses.english: He also made the seven-branched Lampstand of pure, hammered gold. All parts of it were formed and crafted from solid gold.

verses.latin: Bases, et hastile, calamos, et scyphos, et lilia, et omnia ex auro erant.
verses.english: Its base, its central shaft, its branches, its cups, its decorative flower blossoms, and all its other elements were made of gold.

verses.latin: Sex rami egressi sunt de lateribus: tres ex una parte, et tres ex altera.
verses.english: Six branches extended from its sides: three branches on one side and three branches on the other.

verses.latin: Tres scyphi quasi nucis avellanae, per singulos ramos, et sphærulæ simul, et lilia. Et tres similiter scyphi in ramo altero juxta nucis avellanae similitudinem, sphærulæque simul, et lilia.
verses.english: On each of the six branches, there were three cups shaped like almond blossoms, complete with their ornamental knobs and flower petals. The three cups on the other branch were also in the shape of almond blossoms, with their knobs and petals.

verses.latin: Sex rami egressi de hastili candelabri.
verses.english: There were six branches extending from the central shaft of the Lampstand.

verses.latin: Et in ipso hastili candelabri, quatuor scyphi, et sphærulæ simul, et lilia.
verses.english: And on the central shaft itself, there were four cups, shaped like almond blossoms, along with their knobs and petals.

verses.latin: Et sphærulæ sub duobus ramis per loca tria, qui ex ipso procedebant candelabro.
verses.english: There was a knob under each pair of the three sets of branches that extended from the Lampstand's main shaft.

verses.latin: Et sphærula, et calami omnia ex auro purissimo, productilia.
verses.english: All the knobs and stems were made of pure, hammered gold.

verses.latin: Candelabrum quoque cum lucernis suis septem, et emunctoriis, et concipulis, ex auro purissimo fecit.
verses.english: He also made the Lampstand's seven lamps, its snuffers, and its trays, all from pure gold.

verses.latin: Talenta auri purissimi expendit in candelabrum et omnia vasa ejus.
verses.english: He used a talent of pure gold for the Lampstand and all its associated implements.

verses.latin: Fecit et altare thymiamatis de lignis setim, habens per singula latera cubitum, quadratum, id est, et duos cubitos in altitudine: e cujus angulis procedebant cornua.
verses.english: He also made the Altar of Incense from acacia wood. It was square, one cubit long on each side, and two cubits high. Horns extended from its corners.

verses.latin: Et vestivit illud auro purissimo, tam craticulam ejus, quam latera, et cornua. Fecitque ei coronam auream per circuitum.
verses.english: He overlaid the altar—its top, its sides, and its horns—with pure gold. He also made a gold molding around its top edge.

verses.latin: Et duos circulos aureos sub corona per singula latera, ut mittantur in eos vectes, et possit portari.
verses.english: He cast two gold rings and placed them below the molding on two opposite sides, so that poles could be inserted through them to carry it.

verses.latin: Ipsosque vectes fecit de lignis setim, et vestivit eos auro.
verses.english: He made these carrying poles from acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.

verses.latin: Composuit et oleum unctionis sanctum, et incensum de aromatibus purissimum, opere pigmentarii.
verses.english: He also prepared the holy anointing oil and the pure, fragrant incense, following the precise work of a perfumer.

verses.latin: Fecit et altare holocausti de lignis setim, quinque cubitorum longitudinis, et quinque cubitorum latitudinis, id est, quadratum, et trium in altitudine.
verses.english: He also constructed the Altar of Burnt Offering from acacia wood. It was square, five cubits long and five cubits wide, and three cubits high.

verses.latin: Cornuaque ejus ex ipso procedebant: et vestivit illud ære.
verses.english: Its horns were an integral part of it, extending from its corners, and he overlaid the entire altar with bronze.

verses.latin: Et in medio altaris fecit quasi craticulam æneam in modum retis, desuper usque ad mediam partem ejus.
verses.english: In the middle of the altar, he made a bronze grating, in the form of a network, extending from the top down to its halfway point.

verses.latin: Quatuorque anulos fudit in quatuor ejus summitatibus æneos, in quos perticae immitti possent.
verses.english: He cast four bronze rings and attached them to the four upper corners of the grating, so that poles could be inserted into them.

verses.latin: Ipsasque perticas fecit de lignis setim, et vestivit ære.
verses.english: He made these carrying poles from acacia wood and overlaid them with bronze.

verses.latin: Fecit et vasa diversa, ad usum altaris in omnem ritum: lebetes, forcipes, fuscinulas, uncinos, et ignium receptacula, omnia ex ære.
verses.english: He also made all the various utensils for the altar, for every ritual use: basins, meat hooks, shovels, tongs, and firepans—all made of bronze.

verses.latin: Fecit et basim aeneam, prope altare, habens desuper cancellos æneos in modum retis, usque ad mediam partem altaris.
verses.english: He made a bronze base, which was placed near the altar. It had a bronze grating on top, like a network, reaching up to the middle of the altar.

verses.latin: Et quatuor anulos æneos fundens, quos posuit in quatuor summitatibus ejus, ad perticas immittendas.
verses.english: He cast four bronze rings and attached them to its four upper corners for inserting the carrying poles.

verses.latin: Fecit et perticas æneas, quas vestivit ære.
verses.english: He also made bronze carrying poles and overlaid them with bronze.

verses.latin: Et fecit vasa tabernaculi, et omnia utensilia ejus, cortinas quoque, et basim earum.
verses.english: He made all the vessels for the Dwelling (Tabernacle), along with all its other implements, including the curtains and their bases.

verses.latin: Et omnia vasa tabernaculi, in omnes ritus, quos fecit.
verses.english: And he made all the vessels of the Dwelling, for all its prescribed rituals.

verses.latin: Fecit et altare holocausti de lignis setim, quinque cubitorum per longum, et quinque per latum, id est, quadratum, et trium in altum.
verses.english: He also made the altar for burnt offerings out of acacia wood. It was five cubits long and five cubits wide, making it square, and it stood three cubits high.

verses.latin: cornuaque per singulos angulos, quae ex ipso procedebant: et operuit illud laminis aeneis.
verses.english: He made its horns to extend directly from each of its four corners. And he covered the entire altar with bronze plates.

verses.latin: Fecitque in usus ejus diversa vasa: ignium receptacula, forcipes, fuscinulas, uncinos, et foculos: omnia opera ex aere.
verses.english: And he made all the various utensils for the altar's use: pans for gathering ashes, shovels, flesh hooks (three-pronged forks), hooks, and fire pans. All these objects were made entirely of bronze.

verses.latin: Cratemque retis aeneam, juxta altaris concavum, usque ad mediam partem ejus, et quatuor anulos aeneos in quatuor summitatibus ejus, ad quos vectes inferrentur.
verses.english: He also made for it a bronze grating, like a mesh, positioned below the altar's rim and extending halfway down its interior. At the four corners of this grating, he put four bronze rings through which carrying poles could be inserted.

verses.latin: Ipsosque vectes fecit de lignis setim, et operuit laminis aeneis.
verses.english: He also made these carrying poles out of acacia wood and covered them with bronze plates.

verses.latin: Altare autem ipsum quadrifidum, vectibus onustum, portabatur.
verses.english: The altar itself, which had four parts, was carried by these poles.

verses.latin: Fecit et labrum aeneum cum basi sua de speculis mulierum, quae excubabant in foribus tabernaculi.
verses.english: He also made the bronze laver with its bronze base from the mirrors of the women who ministered at the entrance of the Tabernacle.

verses.latin: Fecitque atrium, cujus in australi plaga erant cortinae de bysso retorta, centum cubitorum, et columnae viginti cum basibus suis aeneis, et capitella columnarum cum annulis suis argentea.
verses.english: He also constructed the courtyard. On the south side, there were curtains made of fine twisted linen, one hundred cubits long, supported by twenty bronze pillars with their bronze bases. The capitals of the pillars, and their connecting rods, were made of silver.

verses.latin: In plaga quoque aquilonis, cortinae centum cubitorum, columnae viginti, et bases aeneae, et capitella columnarum cum annulis suis argentea.
verses.english: On the north side, there were also curtains one hundred cubits long, with twenty bronze pillars and their bronze bases. The capitals of the pillars, and their connecting rods, were made of silver.

verses.latin: At vero in plaga occidentali, cortinae per quinquaginta cubitos, columnae decem, et bases decem, et capitella columnarum cum annulis suis argentea.
verses.english: But on the west side, the curtains were fifty cubits long, with ten pillars and ten bases. The capitals of the pillars, and their connecting rods, were made of silver.

verses.latin: In orientali autem plaga, quinquaginta cubitorum erant cortinae.
verses.english: And on the east side, the curtains were fifty cubits long.

verses.latin: Decem cubitos hinc, et decem inde velabant fores atrii. Columnas duas, et bases totidem.
verses.english: Ten cubits on one side and ten cubits on the other covered the entrance of the courtyard, with two pillars and two bases on each side of the entrance.

verses.latin: In parte quoque earum, quae per singulos latera tendebantur, quindecim cubitos, columnasque tres, et bases totidem.
verses.english: On the parts of the courtyard that stretched along each side of the main entrance, the curtains were fifteen cubits long, with three pillars and three bases.

verses.latin: Omnes cortinae atrii de bysso erant torta.
verses.english: All the curtains of the courtyard were made of fine twisted linen.

verses.latin: Bases columnarum aeneae, et capitella earum, uncinique argentei. Columnarum vero ipsarum laminae operiebantur argento.
verses.english: The bases of the pillars were bronze, and their capitals and connecting hooks were silver. The pillars themselves were covered with silver plating.

verses.latin: Et velum pro introitu atrii, opere plumarii, de hyacintho, purpura, vermiculo, et bysso retorta, viginti cubitorum altitudinis, et quinque cubitorum latitudinis, juxta mensuram, quae atrii cortinis per omnia respondebat.
verses.english: And for the entrance of the courtyard, there was a curtain made of embroidered work, woven with blue, purple, scarlet yarns, and fine twisted linen. It was twenty cubits long and five cubits high, corresponding in all respects to the height of the courtyard curtains.

verses.latin: Columnarumque quatuor erant bases aeneae, et capitella argentea, uncinis argenteis vestita, columnarumque ipsarum laminae argento.
verses.english: For this entrance curtain, there were four bronze bases and four silver capitals, fitted with silver connecting hooks, and the pillars themselves were covered with silver plating.

verses.latin: Omnes paxilli tabernaculi, et atrii per circuitum, aenei.
verses.english: All the pegs for the Tabernacle and for the courtyard all around were made of bronze.

verses.latin: Summa auri, et argenti, et aeris, oblati in opus sanctuarii, his enumerata est ponderibus.
verses.english: The total amount of gold, silver, and bronze offered for the work of the sanctuary was recorded by these weights.

verses.latin: Pondus auri, et argenti, et aeris oblati, juxta numerum eorum, qui Mosen interrogaverant, enumerantium onera singulorum in ministerio Levitarum, per manum Ithamar, filii Aaron sacerdotis.
verses.english: The weights of the gold, silver, and bronze offered were tallied according to the count of those who had consulted Moses. Each individual's contribution was registered for the service of the Levites, under the direction of Ithamar, son of Aaron the priest.

verses.latin: Haec sunt instrumenta Tabernaculi testimonii, quae enumerata sunt per Mosen in officium Levitarum, manu Ithamar filii Aaron sacerdotis.
verses.english: These are the items for the Tabernacle of the Testimony —where the covenant documents were kept— which were tallied by Moses, for the service of the Levites, under the direct supervision of Ithamar, son of Aaron the priest.

verses.latin: Beseleel filius Uri filii Hur de tribu Juda, faber et architectus, et sculpsit, et extraxit ex omnibus quae percipi possunt.
verses.english: Bezalel, son of Uri, son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, was the master craftsman and architect. He carved, sculpted, and brought forth all that could be conceived.

verses.latin: Et cum eo Hooliab filius Achisamech de tribu Dan, egregius artifex, et plumarius in hyacintho, et purpura, et cocco bis tincto, et bysso.
verses.english: And with him was Oholiab, son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an excellent craftsman and embroiderer in blue, purple, double-dyed scarlet yarn, and fine linen.

verses.latin: Omne aurum quod expensum est in opere sanctuarii, et quod oblatum est per singulos, viginti novem talenta, et septingenti triginta sicli, ad mensuram sanctuarii.
verses.english: All the gold that was used for the work of the sanctuary, including what was contributed by each individual, amounted to twenty-nine talents and seven hundred thirty shekels, measured by the sacred standard of the sanctuary.

verses.latin: Argenti quoque oblati a recensitis populi, centum talenta, et mille septingenti septuaginta quinque sicli, ad mensuram sanctuarii.
verses.english: The silver offered by those who were registered among the people amounted to one hundred talents and one thousand seven hundred seventy-five shekels, measured by the sacred standard of the sanctuary.

verses.latin: Singula capita: a viginti annis et supra, sena millia et trecenta quinque, didrachma medium, quod est obolum juxta pondus sanctuarii.
verses.english: This was collected from each head of a household, twenty years old and above, from the six hundred three thousand five hundred men. Each man paid half a shekel, which is an obol according to the sacred weight of the sanctuary.

verses.latin: Centum ergo talenta argenti fuerunt, ex quibus conflatae sunt bases sanctuarii, et bases veli: centum bases de centum talentis, singulis talentis per bases singulas propensum.
verses.english: Thus, there were one hundred talents of silver. From this silver, the bases for the sanctuary and the bases for the veil were cast: one hundred bases from one hundred talents, with one talent used for each base.

verses.latin: De mille vero septingentis septuaginta quinque siclis, uncinos in columnis fecit, quas et laminis texit, et annulis junxit.
verses.english: And from the one thousand seven hundred seventy-five shekels, he made the connecting hooks for the pillars, covered the pillar capitals with silver plating, and joined them with rings.

verses.latin: Aeris quoque oblati, septuaginta duo millia talentorum, et quadringenti sicli, ad mensuram sanctuarii.
verses.english: The bronze offered amounted to seventy-two talents and four hundred shekels, measured by the sacred standard of the sanctuary.

verses.latin: Ex quo factae sunt bases in foribus tabernaculi testimonii, et altare aeneum, et cratis ejus, et universa vasa ejus,
verses.english: From this bronze, he made the bases for the entrance of the Tabernacle of the Testimony, the bronze altar, its bronze grating, and all its utensils.

verses.latin: Et bases atrii per gyrum, ac veli ejus in introitu, et paxilli tabernaculi, omnesque paxilli atrii per circuitum.
verses.english: It was also used for the bases of the courtyard all around, and for its curtain at the entrance, and for all the pegs of the Tabernacle, and all the pegs for the courtyard all around.

verses.latin: Igitur de hyacinthino et purpura bis tincta coccoque, fecerunt vestes, quibus sacerdotes induerentur, quando ministrant in Sanctis: sicut praecepit Dominus Moysi.
verses.english: Therefore, from the violet, double-dyed purple, and scarlet threads, they made the garments that the priests were to wear when they ministered in the holy places and rituals, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.

verses.latin: Fecit igitur ephod de auro, hyacinthino et purpura bis tincta, coccoque, et bysso retorta.
verses.english: So they made the ephod from gold, violet, double-dyed purple, scarlet thread, and fine twisted linen.

verses.latin: Et incidit laminas aureas, et traxit in fila, ut possent torqueri cum prioribus, hyacinthino scilicet et purpura bis tincta, coccoque, et bysso subtilissima, opere polymitario.
verses.english: They cut golden plates and hammered them into fine threads, so they could be twisted together with the other threads: the violet, double-dyed purple, scarlet, and very fine linen, all crafted with embroidered work.

verses.latin: Duo humerália faciens, ex utraque parte, in conjunctione ligata sunt.
verses.english: They made two shoulder pieces for it, which were connected on each side at the joining points.

verses.latin: Et cingulum ipsius, ex iisdem materiis, sicut praecepit Dominus Moysi.
verses.english: Its woven waistband was made of the very same materials, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.

verses.latin: Paraverunt quoque duos lapides onychinos, inclusos auro, et sculptos arte gemmaria, nominibus filiorum Israël:
verses.english: They also prepared two onyx stones, set in gold filigree, and engraved them with the names of the sons of Israel, using the art of a gem cutter.

verses.latin: posueruntque eos in humerálibus ephod, in monumentum filiorum Israël, sicut praecepit Dominus Moysi.
verses.english: They placed these stones on the shoulder pieces of the ephod as a memorial for the sons of Israel, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.

verses.latin: Fecit et rationale opere polymito, juxta opus ephod, de auro, hyacinthino et purpura bis tincta, coccoque, et bysso retorta.
verses.english: They also made the breastplate with embroidered work, similar to the work of the ephod, from gold, violet, double-dyed purple, scarlet thread, and twisted fine linen.

verses.latin: Quadrum duplex erat, mensurae palmi singuli.
verses.english: It was square and doubled over, measuring one palm's length on each side.

verses.latin: Et posuerunt in eo quatuor ordines lapidum. Primum ordinem: sardius, topazius, smaragdus.
verses.english: They set four rows of precious stones in it. The first row had a sardius, a topaz, and an emerald.

verses.latin: Secundus: carbunculus, sapphirus, jaspis.
verses.english: The second row had a carbuncle, a sapphire, and a jasper.

verses.latin: Tertius: ligurius, achates, amethystus.
verses.english: The third row had a ligurius, an agate, and an amethyst.

verses.latin: Quartus: chrysolithus, onychinus, beryllus, distincti auro, et opere junctissimi.
verses.english: The fourth row had a chrysolite, an onyx, and a beryl. All these stones were set in gold filigree and perfectly joined together.

verses.latin: Duodecim autem lapides duodecim nominibus Israël, singuli per nomina singulorum, arte sculptoris et opere gemmarii.
verses.english: There were twelve stones, corresponding to the twelve names of Israel, each engraved with a single name by the art of a sculptor and gem cutter.

verses.latin: Fecerunt in rationali catenulas sibi invicem cohaerentes, de auro purissimo.
verses.english: They made chains for the breastplate, linked to each other, out of pure gold.

verses.latin: Et duos uncinos aureos, et totidem annulos, qui jungi possent utrinque rationali.
verses.english: They also made two gold clasps and two gold rings, which could be joined to the breastplate on both sides.

verses.latin: Quibus insererent binas catenulas aureas, et appendere humerálibus ephod.
verses.english: Through these rings, they inserted the two gold chains and attached them to the shoulder pieces of the ephod.

verses.latin: Duo quoque margines, et duos annulos aureos, et posuerunt annulos in utraque parte rationalis.
verses.english: They also made two gold borders and two gold rings, and placed these rings on each side of the breastplate.

verses.latin: Et duos alios annulos aureos, quos fixêre in duabus extremitatibus humerálium ephod intrinsecus, contra conjunctionem.
verses.english: And two other gold rings they fastened on the two lower edges of the ephod, on the inside, near where it was joined.

verses.latin: Ut aptari posset rationale, et stringi juncturis anuli et catenularum.
verses.english: This was so the breastplate could be fastened and secured by the rings and chains joining it.

verses.latin: Et vinctum est rationale annulis suis ad annulos ephod, funiculo hyacinthino, ut a conjunctorum sibi textu separari non posset, sicut praecepit Dominus Moysi.
verses.english: And the breastplate was bound by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a violet cord, so it could not become separated from the woven material it was joined to, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.

verses.latin: Fecit quoque pallium ephod totum hyacinthinum,
verses.english: They also made the robe of the ephod entirely of violet thread.

verses.latin: et oram scuti per medium, ut palliári posset, et ora eius textilis in gyro.
verses.english: And there was an opening in the middle of it, like the opening of a coat of mail, so it could be put on, and its opening was reinforced with woven work all around.

verses.latin: Et deorsum, in circuitu ejusdem pallioli, quasi mala punica, de hyacinthino et purpura bis tincta, coccoque, et bysso retorta.
verses.english: And at the bottom, all around the hem of this robe, they made decorations resembling pomegranates, using violet, double-dyed purple, scarlet thread, and twisted fine linen.

verses.latin: Tintinnabula quoque de auro purissimo, quae posuerunt inter malagranata, in circuitu orae pallioli,
verses.english: They also made bells of pure gold and placed them between the pomegranates, all around the hem of the robe.

verses.latin: ut et tintinnabulum et malum punicum esset in gyro: sicut praecepit Dominus Moysi.
verses.english: So there was a bell and a pomegranate alternating all around the hem, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.

verses.latin: Fecerunt et tunicas byssinas opere textili Moysi et filiis ejus,
verses.english: They also made tunics of fine linen, woven work, for Moses and his sons.

verses.latin: et mitras de bysso, et tiaras byssinas, et feminalia linea byssina.
verses.english: And turbans of fine linen, and elegant linen caps, and linen breeches of fine linen.

verses.latin: Zonam quoque de bysso retorta, et hyacinthino et purpura bis tincta, coccoque, opere polymito, sicut praecepit Dominus Moysi.
verses.english: They also made a sash of twisted fine linen, and violet, double-dyed purple, and scarlet thread, all with embroidered work, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.

verses.latin: Fecerunt et laminam sacri consecrationis, de auro purissimo, scripseruntque in ea opere sculptoris, Sanctum Domini.
verses.english: They also made the plate for the holy consecration, from pure gold, and engraved on it, with the work of a sculptor: 'Holy to the Lord.'

verses.latin: Ligavéruntque eam in summitate tiarae, funiculo hyacinthino, sicut praecepit Dominus Moysi.
verses.english: They fastened it to the top of the turban with a violet cord, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.

verses.latin: Perfectúmque est omne opus tabernaculi, et tecti foederis: feceruntque filii Israël omnia, quae praeceperat Dominus Moysi.
verses.english: So all the work of the Tabernacle and the Tent of the Covenant was completed. The sons of Israel did everything just as the Lord had commanded Moses.

verses.latin: Et obtulerunt tabernaculum, et tectum, et omnem apparatum, annulos, tabulas, vectes, columnas, bases.
verses.english: And they brought the Tabernacle to Moses, along with the tent covering, and all its furnishings: the clasps, the planks, the bars, the pillars, and the bases.

verses.latin: Tectum de pellibus arietum rubris, et aliud operimentum de pellibus hyacinthinis.
verses.english: They brought the covering of ram skins dyed red, and the other outer covering made of violet-dyed animal skins.

verses.latin: Propitiatórium, et mensam cum vasis suis, candelabrum cum lucernis suis, et omnem apparatum ejus.
verses.english: They brought the mercy seat, the table with all its utensils, the lampstand with its lamps, and all its accessories.

verses.latin: Altaria aurea, et unctionis oleum, thymiamatis compositionem, et velum ostii tabernaculi.
verses.english: They brought the golden altars, the anointing oil, the fragrant incense, and the veil for the entrance of the Tabernacle.

verses.latin: Altare aereum, craticulam ejus æneam, vectes, et vasa omnia ejus, labrum cum basi sua.
verses.english: They brought the bronze altar, its bronze grating, its poles, and all its utensils, along with the laver and its base.

verses.latin: Cortinas atrii, et columnas earum, bases, et velum in foribus atrii, funiculos, et paxillos ejus, et omnia vasa ministerii tabernaculi, atque tecti foederis.
verses.english: They brought the hangings for the courtyard, and its pillars, its bases, and the veil for the gate of the courtyard, its cords, and its pegs, and all the utensils for the service of the Tabernacle and the Tent of the Covenant.

verses.latin: Vestes, quibus sacerdotes utuntur cum ministrant in Sanctis.
verses.english: They brought the garments that the priests wore when they ministered in the holy places and rituals.

verses.latin: Sicut praecepit Dominus Moysi, ita fecerunt omnes filii Israël.
verses.english: Just as the Lord had commanded Moses, so all the sons of Israel did everything.

verses.latin: Locutusque est Dominus ad Moysen dicens:
verses.english: The Lord then spoke to Moses and said:

verses.latin: Primo mense, die prima mensis, eriges tabernaculum testimonii.
verses.english: On the first day of the first month, you shall set up the tent for the Ark of the Covenant, which bears witness to My covenant with Israel.

verses.latin: Et pones in eo arcam testamenti, et velabis illam velo.
verses.english: Inside the tent, you shall place the Ark of the Covenant. Then you shall shield it with a veil.

verses.latin: Et introduces mensam, ac per ordinem componis ea quae super eam poni debent: candelabrumque constitues cum lucernis suis.
verses.english: You shall bring in the table of the bread of the presence, and in proper order, you will arrange everything that belongs on it. You will then set up the lampstand with its lamps.

verses.latin: Et pones altare aureum thymiamatis coram arca testamenti, et tentorium in introitu tabernaculi.
verses.english: You shall place the golden altar for incense offerings in front of the Ark of the Covenant. And you shall hang the curtain at the entrance of the tent.

verses.latin: Et ante illud pones altare holocausti.
verses.english: And in front of that altar, you shall place the altar for burnt offerings.

verses.latin: Labrum inter altare et tabernaculum, implens illud aqua.
verses.english: You shall place the basin for washing between the altar and the tent, filling it with water.

verses.latin: Et circumdabis atrium tentorio, omnemque ingressum ejus velo.
verses.english: You shall then enclose the courtyard with its curtains and hang the curtain at the entrance of the entire courtyard.

verses.latin: Et assumptis unctionis oleo, unges tabernaculum cum omnibus vasis suis, ut sanctificentur.
verses.english: Then you shall take the anointing oil and anoint the tent with all of its furnishings and vessels so that they may be set apart as holy to God.

verses.latin: Altare quoque holocausti et omnia vasa ejus unctione consecrabis.
verses.english: You shall also consecrate the altar for burnt offerings and all its vessels by anointing them.

verses.latin: Labrum cum basi sua unges, sanctificabisque.
verses.english: You shall anoint the washing basin with its stand, and you shall set them apart as holy.

verses.latin: Et applicabis Aaron et filios ejus ad fores tabernaculi testimonii. Cumque laveris eos aqua,
verses.english: You shall bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance of the tent of the Ark of the Covenant. And when you have washed them with water,

verses.latin: indues Aaron vestimentis sanctis, ungesque eum, et sanctificabis in sacerdotium mihi.
verses.english: you shall dress Aaron in the holy garments. You shall anoint him and set him apart as holy to serve Me as a priest.

verses.latin: Filios quoque illius applicabis, et indues tunicis.
verses.english: You shall also bring his sons and dress them in tunics.

verses.latin: Et unges eos, sicut unxisti patrem eorum, ut sacerdotio fungantur mihi: et erit unctio eis in sacerdotium sempiternum per successiones eorum.
verses.english: You shall anoint them just as you anointed their father, so that they may serve Me as priests. And this anointing shall be for them a perpetual priesthood throughout their generations.

verses.latin: Fecitque Moyses omnia quae praeceperat Dominus.
verses.english: And Moses did everything exactly as the Lord had commanded him.

verses.latin: Igitur primo mense, secundo anno, prima die mensis, erectum est tabernaculum.
verses.english: So, in the first month of the second year, on the first day of that month, the tent for the Ark of the Covenant was set up.

verses.latin: Erexitque Moyses tabernaculum, et posuit tabulas, ac bases, et vectes, et columnas.
verses.english: Moses set up the tent, placed its planks, its bases, its crossbars, and its pillars.

verses.latin: Expanditque tectum super tabernaculum, et posuit desuper operimentum, sicut Dominus imperaverat.
verses.english: He spread the covering over the tent and placed the outer covering on top of it, just as the Lord had commanded.

verses.latin: Tulit et posuit testimonium in arca, subjecitque desuper propitiatorium, et introduxit arcam in tabernaculum.
verses.english: He then took the tablets of the covenant and placed them inside the Ark. He placed the atonement cover on top of the Ark, and he brought the Ark into the tent.

verses.latin: Et appendit velum ante illam, sicut praeceperat Dominus.
verses.english: And he hung the veil in front of it, just as the Lord had commanded.

verses.latin: Posuit et mensam in tabernaculo testimonii, ad plagam septentrionalem extra velum.
verses.english: He also placed the table in the tent of the Ark of the Covenant, on the north side, outside the veil.

verses.latin: Et panibus rite compositis coram Domino, sicut praeceperat Dominus Moysi.
verses.english: And he properly arranged the bread of the presence on it before the Lord, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.

verses.latin: Candelabrum quoque posuit in tabernaculo testimonii, contra mensam in parte meridiana,
verses.english: He also placed the lampstand in the tent of the Ark of the Covenant, opposite the table, on the south side.

verses.latin: appositis lucernis per ordinem juxta praeceptum Domini.
verses.english: He arranged the lamps in their proper order according to the Lord's command.

verses.latin: Posuit et altare aureum in tabernaculo testimonii coram velo,
verses.english: He also placed the golden altar for incense in the tent of the Ark of the Covenant, in front of the veil.

verses.latin: adolens in eo incensum aromatum, sicut jusserat Dominus Moysi.
verses.english: He burned fragrant incense on it, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.

verses.latin: Et appendit tentorium in introitu tabernaculi.
verses.english: And he hung the curtain at the entrance of the tent.

verses.latin: Altare holocausti posuit in introitu tabernaculi testimonii, offerens in eo holocaustum, et sacrificia, sicut Dominus imperaverat.
verses.english: He placed the altar for burnt offerings at the entrance of the tent of the Ark of the Covenant, and he offered burnt offerings and other sacrifices on it, just as the Lord had commanded.

verses.latin: Labrumque statuit inter tabernaculum testimonii et altare, implens illud aqua.
verses.english: And he set the washing basin between the tent of the Ark of the Covenant and the altar, filling it with water.

verses.latin: Et lavabant in eo Moyses et Aaron cum filiis suis manus et pedes,
verses.english: In it, Moses and Aaron, along with his sons, washed their hands and their feet.

verses.latin: quando ingrederentur tabernaculum foederis, et accederent ad altare, sicut praeceperat Dominus Moysi.
verses.english: They would wash whenever they entered the tent of the covenant and whenever they approached the altar, just as the Lord had commanded Moses.

verses.latin: Erexit quoque atrium per circuitum tabernaculi et altaris, ducens velum in introitu atrii. Postquam omnia perfecta sunt,
verses.english: He also erected the courtyard around the tent and the altar, setting up the curtain at the entrance of the courtyard. After everything was completed,

verses.latin: operuit nubes tabernaculum testimonii, et gloria Domini implevit illud.
verses.english: a cloud covered the tent of the Ark of the Covenant, and the glory of the Lord filled it completely.

verses.latin: Nec poterat Moyses ingredi tectum foederis, nube opertus, et majestate Domini illustris.
verses.english: And Moses was unable to enter the tent of the covenant because the cloud had covered it, and the majesty of the Lord shone brightly within it.

verses.latin: Si quando nubes recessisset de tabernaculo, proficiscebantur filii Israel per turmas suas.
verses.english: Whenever the cloud lifted from the tent, the children of Israel would travel, moving forward in their groups.

verses.latin: Si persisteret desuper, manebant in eodem loco.
verses.english: If the cloud remained above, they would stay in the same place.

verses.latin: Nubes quippe Domini incubabat per diem tabernaculo, et ignis in nocte, cunctis Israel videntibus per cunctas mansiones suas.
verses.english: For the Lord's cloud rested upon the tent by day, and a fire was in it by night. All of Israel could see this, throughout all their journeys and encampments.
